story:
Forget about having lots of remote controls at home, and forget about searching them on the side of the couch, now you can have a very unique Universal Remote, at the palm of your hand.

A great idea, that gets closer to be real.

InstaMote makes a huge difference in terms of durability and functionality, every single InfraRed controlled device is compatible, also, any iOS 5+, or Android 2.3+ device is fully compatible.

Also, this compatibility makes possible the use of any app that controls the Samsung Galaxy IR Blaster, or the designed app for iOS.

The app is being developed as fast as possible, but take a look to some examples:

Don't spend lots of money in senseless "Universal" Remotes, use an unique solution, that will change all your old remotes



We are closer to get this product done:

  • We have done many small projects like this before, and now, we reached a new stage.
  • The InstaMote has a built-in battery that allows to use in a comfortable way it's IR module.  This battery lasts approximately 6 months under heavy usage, and can be easily replaced.
  • Several experiments took place to improve space usage (meaning size of the product) and now we have the first functional prototype, manufactured with the help of a Korean and Chinese company, that builds similar modules
  • The packaging it's intended to save your InstaMote and give a nice aspect on the final product.


The InstaMote, compared to the remote control, has a bigger working range, and more compatibility than a standard universal remote.

Here is a comparative chart:

Specification/Device

InstaMote

Regular Universal Remote

Battery

Single battery, up to 6 months, and easy to replace

2 AA or AAA batteries, depends on the battery, to 4 to 8 months

Compatibility

All IR controlled devices (InfraRed), A/C, fans, DVD, TV, Bluray, PS3, etcetera

Sometimes just TV and DVD’s

Max distance

Up to 15 meters, effective range

Sometimes reach the 5-9 meters, and any obstacle prevents the signal to reach the TV or DVD

Price

Just 8 USD, at early offer, and 12 in standard price

Up to 14 USD, sometimes cheaper, but with low quality and compatibility

Featured on:

We will use the funds exclusively to improve this product

Any help is well received.


Each unit is:
$0.95               IR LED
$1.45               All small electronics
$0.25              Welding
$0.92             Casing (SPEC Plastic)
$1.31              3.5 mm jack, and the rest of the conectors
$1.50              Small battery, high performance

 

Please add $5 US dollars, for international shipping (outside Switzerland), or we will not be able to send your InstaMote.

story:
What is SpectaCube?

SpectaCube is the world's first IoT (Internet of Things) based mobile workbench designed to support IoT developers, during their prototyping and development levels. 

SpectaCube offers IoT Developers:
  • To stay  organized 
  • Manage boards, sensors and components
  • Portable work environment
  • Valuable space in workshops or at home
  • Test & develop new components quickly based on the premises of BigData and Cloud-Computing

Why is SpectaCube so fantastic?
Before using SpectaCube I aquired almost 40% of the space in our living-room for all my components and gadgets!
Organize your workspace!

SpectaCube was at first meant to be something similar to an organizer, to help me to keep my IoT stuff in order, like development-boards components and so on. 

Here are some pictures of the prototype:

SpectaCube Prototype Side-View - Housing an Intel Galileo Gen 2 Board

Empty Inner-Plate on the front-side of the SpectaCube prototype

A second Raspberry Pi and the side view of the Extender-Prototype Mounting Plate

And if you think about the investments in terms of money and time, it is important to know that your components are well kept within a safe environment.

SpectraCube helps IoT developers with the management of IoT components like boards and sensors.

Currently the built-in prototype firmware allows you to:

  • Monitor and manage your development boards
  • Monitor the SpectraCube working environment
  • Gather sensor data and visualize the sensor data 
  •  To connect your sensors to the cloud for testing purposes
  • To switch your devices on or off
  • Connectivity and Internet Access 
Another advantage of the built-in firmware is, that it is written in Node.js and C#. This will allow you to develop and test using the tools of your choice.
Screenshots of the user interface (currently under development, running on a Raspberry PI 2, (using Windows 10 for Devices or Linux):

Environmental Parameters


Power Management

Integrated SSH-Shell


Mobile Views

Hardware Implementation Details
Inner Core

The inner core will be made of anodized blue Aluminium which makes it more resistible, durable and esthetically pleasing. 
The frame will be build using 3-way connectors, made of highly-durable plastics:


Volume Extender Boxes

VEB's allow to extend the available space even further. They are the right place to keep components like resistors, capacitors or small tools. Extenders will be available in three sizes:
  • 20 x 5 x 5 cm's or 7.8" x 1.9" x 1.9"  - For larger components or tools
  • 10 x 5 x 5 cm's or  3.9" x 1.9" x 1.9" - For middle sized components
  • 5 x 5  x 5 cm's  or  1.9" x 1.9" x 1.9"  - For small components
They have a sophisticated and simple extension plate on the back, that guarantees great stability. It will be and feel just solid.

Here is a stacking example using 10 different VEB's:

The components listed will be available in more color variations and we will add the possibility to bring in your own design ideas and colors. Customize your SpectaCube!

Workbench Characteristics

Laying out all the mounting plates on a table, will give you instantly a possible working environment of 6 times 20 x 20 cm's (400 square cm's) or 6 times 7,87" (363 square inch) of working space on any flat surface:

Other possible scenarios include presentations, or showcasing new components:

 

Mounting Plates

Mounting plates are another way of extending the SpectaCube and to add new features. The "Hole Plate" can be used to mount additional components from the outside or simply on a table. More outer plates are currently designed offering a broad set of new features. 

The soldering plate can be used for soldering. It will have a special ceramic based coating that is extremely durable and heat resistant.

Top-Extenders will be used to allow over-sized components to be placed within SpectaCube. This is a very early design. It will come in more variations with for different usage-scenarios.

The "Extender" is designed to carry the VEB's and blade-extensions as well as different other extensions that are currently designed. We will keep you updated about new features and extensions as soon as they are ready.

Hole Plate

Extender



Soldering Plate


Top Extender


Power
We are currently evaluating different types of power-supplies, USB-Hubs, battery-Packs, and solar-based extensions. Stay tuned for more details.

Development & Rapid Prototyping

SpectaCube will come with several pre-installed API's for the IoT like the Alljoyn, a custom framework called IoTZen for accelerated testing, a sensor and devices-dashboard and more. Stay tuned for additional updates.


Portable

SpectaCube will be completely portable and ready to go when you need it. We will reveal additional options very soon.

Themable

SpectaCube will allow you to create your own branding and design on each and every component delivered. We are currently speaking to potential partners and we will update you as soon as we know more.

What we will use Your Money for

The first batch of money will be used to produce the first batch of SpectaCube's for our backers and to hire an electronics engineer to evaluate different aspects we need to be evaluated to create a secure and long lasting product.

None of our backers will be excluded from a special offer after this campaign. Backers with a funding sum $500 will get one of the first SpectraCubes (planned batch is 10 pieces for these backers) with a special plate and their names carved in!

Vision

From our perspective, SpectaCube should be the first official educational device used in schools and universities. We want each student to have her/his own SpectaCube, equipped with the latest IoT gadgets. Therefore it has to meet high-quality and security standards. We are working on this already.


As a backer you will not only boost our development, but the future of your children. We are ready and willing to take this responsibility and we will work hard to make this vision true. No child should be excluded from the job-market of tomorrow. Let's work on this together!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is of course, that we would be unable to build the SpectraCube on a broader range because we don't raise enough money. 

In either case, you can keep your perks and we will keep you on the list and try to fund SpectraCube trough different channels. We are already working on this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Give us feedback! Spread the word about SpectaCube on Twitter, Facebook, etc.! Let us know what features YOU are missing, what you would change. Become a contributing member! We appreciate and value every single contribution. Thank you.

story:
My name is Roberto, i’m 24 years old and i’m in charge of a team of independent developers involved in the creation of useful applications to improve people lives

Our goal is to design and implement the application ImFine.

Why “imFine”?

The problem of security, both in civil and business environment, takes on an increasing importance nowadays.  Technology can play an important role in the prevention of risks arising from the absence of a constant control for elderly and children or people who work in places at risk.

So many times we can not control too close our children while they play, as it is virtually impossible to control constantly the elderly, especially when living alone.

At the same time, work on extended construction sites causes the inability to control the health and the absence of accidents of individual workers.

How many times happened that your children want to play in the garden and you were unable to control them?

How many times an elderly fell at home and was unable to call anybody to be helped?

How many times, in a construction site, an accident was not promptly reported?

Imfine will solve those problems


Thanks to the accelerometer, GPS and gyroscope , sensors already present in all smartphones, even medium-low range, imfine will help you  to keep under control all the interested subjects.

The application is based, essentially, on the association between two or more devices.

When you associete two or more smartphone, imfine, through the use of appropriate sensors, will automatically alert all the linked devices in case of fall of smartphone’s owner.

Now think to an elder that lives alone. In case of  fall or accident, the phone will automatically send to the devices associated the emergency notification with the last known position.


We know that a smartphone, if it is used by a child or by a worker in a construction site, undergoes many stresses and accidental falls.

That is why our goal is to build also an hardware, such as a bracelet, to be used under a specific network or to be associated with a “controller” smartphone.

Through the use of a bracelet containing the same sensors of a smartphone such as GPS, gyroscope and accelerometer,  you have the same chance of detecting possible falls of the subject excluding "false positives" case like the simple fall of the smartphone.

imFine will be equipped with several features based on the needs of the buyer.
All versions will be equipped with a fall sensor and GPS.
Other features will be designed for the security of individual users of the application.

The bracelet prepared for the children will be equipped with a microphone. If your child will cry you will be able to notice that.


For the elderly, we will implement  a bracelet able to control vital parameters and an emergency button.

ImFine will help you have the freedom to get away for a moment from your grandparents.  In case of illness, through the emergency button, your grandparents will be able to alert you.

The same emergency button will be installed also on imfine “work” version.

The workers will be able to immediately communicate an accident to foreman and relief workers.

ImFine will be also equipped with a function to cancel the emergency signal to avoid incurring in false alarms, for example, from accidental contact with the emergency button.



We need money to realize 100% working prototype of bracelet, we need to set up a server for realtime notification.

The app will be free on every marketplace and app store.



ImFine will make your life and the lives of your loved ones safer. It will help to ensure that workers on construction sites are fine. Donate a few dollars to ImFine could help sav. Why not do it?


Share the campaign with everyone you know! Remember, this is not just restricted to email, you can share on Twitter and Facebook.

story:
Just in time for the holidays, it's the ultimate gift for the geek in your life.

If the other Glass didn't do much for you, these will. And for a fraction of the price. Faux .Glass is the Glass for the rest of us. Like others, it doesn't do much of anything useful but you'll look ultra cool. Plus, it'll let you send out secret Faux messages that only other Faux users can understand. And if we see you in your Faux on our Faux.Glass site, you're entered in a chance to win a walk down the FashionWare Runway at this year's 2015 CES in Las Vegas.
 

Why Faux?

Did you ever wish
you could be
as cool as her?
 

Or even him?
 

The Wait Is  Over

Like you, we felt pretty left out of the club when asked to plunk down $1500 for the privilege of being an explorer. So we figured we'd make our own club.

We created Faux Glass for the other 99% who want to look cool without the pocketbook drain.
 

What is Faux Glass?

Faux means fake.
But what these glasses lack in functionality they make up for in personality.
 

What can you do with Faux?

You can use the series of colored LEDS on the frame to speak the secret Faux language (found in the Fauxpedia of course!). Examples:

  • iFaux-to
    Snap a memory with the faux camera. You'll never take a bad picture when they're all fake.
  • Where the Faux?
    It's the special mapping feature that will leave you just as lost as when you use a real GPS.
  • Mo-Faux
    Show the world that you're the biggest faux of them all. Want more?

Use Faux Glass magnifier prism and light and you'll actually be able to order off a menu in a dark restaurant or beam a friend from across the room. Faux Glass even has a built in Faux-solar panel to keep you pretending to be re-charging. The first imaginary energy efficient glasses.
 

Get Your Faux-Jo Going

We give you a Fauxpedia of 10 ways to flash your friends, but we want you to show us your Faux style. We're opening our Faux API to you. Send us your best Faux commands or a photo of you wearing your Faux in some outlandish scene and you might get chosen to be our guest at the International CES 2015. One lucky winner will get to model your personal Faux Glass in a CES high tech FashionWare Show. No Faux-ing around!

Reasons to Go Faux
  • IT'S THE ULTIMATE BINARY MACHINE: Like Morse Code before it, using Faux Glass is as easy as tapping out a code.
  • IDIOT PROOF: No manual, no instructions. If you can tap you're good.
  • DESCTRUCTIBILE:  Destroy them and you're out the cost of a few lattes. It's just a Faux pas.
  • BIG TECHIE, SMALL POCKETS? These glasses sell for $20, shipping and handling included. Buy 'em in bulk. The more you buy the less you'll spend.

If you donate us we will send you a gift!

We do not only say to you thank you! We will send you a pendrive or a T-shirt for helping our project. You can choose S, M, L, XL, XXL t-shirts from multiple color and design. Just tell us wich one you like!

Available colors: white, orange, and black. The other designs in the gallery.

Short Summary

I have started development about a year ago. I worked a lots of on this project. I would like to create an easy to use file sharing solution for everyone in the world.

No more boring waiting time with boxy!
Usually you have to wait 20 seconds before you can start downloading your file or watching your video clip. I think
 it's not a fair thing from a file sharing solution. Imagine that you just clicked on your link and you get your download instantly without
 buying any premium account. Boxy file sharing is simple and easy. You click and get what you want instantly. You won't have to close hundreds
 of pop-ups. You won't have to wait. There are some advertisements on boxy of course, but not against the usability of the file sharing solution.
 We want to create a solution that we too like to use and that everyone like to use, cos it's easy an quick.

Premium account?
Forget it! You don't need it if you want share files or download anything or use all solutions that boxy offers to you. Usually you can't
 use your full bandwidth if you don't pay extra fee for it, but not with boxy. We don't limit your bandwidth. You can upload as quick your
 internet connection allow it, and you can download incredible fast your files too. You will be able to use every features if you don't have
premium even.

Full bandwidth upload and download!
As I wrote up, we wont limit your bandwidth. It's very important if you are a hardcore user. If you want to upload 100GB or 200GB in a few hours, than you can do it if you have quick internet connection. It's just up to you.

Modern technology for file sharing
I think file sharing includes not only the normal upload and download solutions, but FTP, SFTP or torrent and other things. Boxy allows you to use torrent for uploading or for downloading files and of course you will be able to use FTP.

Old pc, slow internet that you have?
No problem, we take care about it. Boxy doesn't have large requirements and it will be easy to use from any devices that you have. Even if that is an old pc or a mobile device.

Features

Now (we need at leas 1000usd for 10 month to not loose these):
  • Simple HTTP download
  • Torrent client to download files
  • QR codes for mobile devices
  • Virus defense (before you download you will see if the file may contains virus or not)
  • Online video player
  • Online Audio player
  • Online document reader
  • FTP upload
  • Private FTP storage
  • Password protected files or download lists
  • Download lists
  • Upload from other websites
  • Hungarian language, some English (in progress)
  • Application for android devices (working, but in progress)
  • Online image galleries
  • etc.
After 3000usd:
Full english translation, better design.
We can get more servers for the next 10 months.

After 25 000usd:
  • Online audio/video stream or just audio or video stream. Like a radio.
  • Forum (in progress)
  • SMS messages about your news (uploading finished, deleted upload, etc)
  • Online conference channels
  • Upload your files with torrent client!
  • Expand your PC HDD with our server capacity
  • And the best! You will able to sell your softwares, uploads on our website. And you will able to earn money with online streams.
  • Full English and German translation.
  • etc.

After 40 000usd:
A lot's of more features like applications for every devices. Huge file uploading for everyone like 10gb/files. Ultrafast bandwidth and no limitation for one year. (20Gbit/s for the servers)...

After 50 000usd:
We will translate our website to French, English, German, Russian, and much more languages, minimum 20 languages will be available.

What We Need & What You Get

We need:

  • to buy our own servers
  • set a room for our servers
  • make more and more programming to get more useful solutions
  • we need a translator (from Hungarian to English, from Hungarian to German)
  • a designer to make better and more friendly design

You get:

  • Free file sharing and file hosting service
  • We will try to give you almost unlimited storage for your files that you want to share with other people.
  • We give you a solution not only for pc, but for any mobile device too.
The first version was this uggly one:


The Impact

We want to give you a software that includes every way used in files haring like torrent upload and torrent download. Like FTP upload and FTP download or get your files from other sites or just use a private FTP that only you can use. And also online audio/video player or document reader. And may you can use our web-server as your HDD in your computer. And much more that we want.

Off course we want to make money with this solution, but not from premium users, only from advertisements. So we want to give this solution for free if we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you have some old, used server computer or router, etc you can help if you give them to us to use it for our solution.
  • You may can give us other useful stuffs to run our servers...

And that’s all there is to it.

We want to go to the USA with our servers. But we are a Hungarian team. Nowadays we are in Hungary, if we reach the limit we will be able to make everything good.

Please share this project with your friends if you like it!

story:
Introducing The Ultimate Device Charging Briefcase

Legion Concepts, has developed a high quality Device Charging Briefcase that offers a new communication experience and delivers a great day-to-day economical travel solution. 

In The Media

Shanghai-based Legion Concept has launched a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo this week for its ultimate device charging briefcase.

Legion’s briefcase features a 10,000mAh removable battery that is able to charge smartphones five times and tablets once. Because of the battery, you can charge devices on the go, which means no more hunting for free outlets at airports and cafes.

“People who utilize smartphones to the full potential need to recharge after a few hours, and in-device battery capacity is just too small,” said Michael Bates, Founder and CEO of Legion Concepts. “Many of us have become outlet huggers, so our goal is to liberate people from outlets and give freedom to our daily lives; for power users this briefcase really is lifestyle insurance.” - Mellisa Tolentino

Briefcase Features

1.  DEVICE CHARGING

Charge three of your devices simultaneously on-the-go!  With a 10,000 mAh integrated removable battery, the Legion Concepts briefcase can charge most smartphones over 5 times, and tablet over 1 time.   With four charging pockets, you can charge three of your devices simultaneously whenever and wherever you want. 

2.  iOS & ANDROID COMPATIBLE

We all use different types of devices and sometimes they need to be charged simultaneously.  Legion Concepts charging briefcase contains a set of adapters to suit your demands.  Adapters work with Android, iOS, Windows, Blackberry, Nokia 5300, E-readers, and PSP.

3.  BAG-TO-WALL CHARGING

Recharging your briefcase is a snap.  With a dedicated briefcase charging pocket and cable, simply pull out the USB charging cable and plug into any outlet.  

4.  USB CABLE MANAGEMENT

Keep your cables organized and out-of-sight.  The whole charging system is integrated in the briefcase.  Yet, it is also easy for you to access them.  Simply unzip the dedicated battery section and weave charging cables through cable pass throughs.

5.  TSA PASS FRIENDLY

Traveling with your laptop just got easier by keeping your laptop inside your briefcase during TSA X-ray screening at the airport.  A specially designed computer section helps you pass through airport security in a breeze.

6.  ORGANIZATION REFINED

With numerous pockets, you now can organize your business travel!  Files, clothing, cellphones, tablets, name cards, passport, tickets.  A place for everything.


Briefcase Materials

We have sourced materials from over 10 suppliers and worked with them for over a year to provide high quality material with economical cost structures.


What We Need & What You Get

We need USD $50,000 to purchase raw materials, pay for molds and tooling, and to get your bag manufactured.  To make the briefcase economical we need economies of scale which means we need volume to meet minimum orders for the briefcase fabrics, clips, PCB boards, integrated circuits, battery, micro-USB cables, adapters, and YKK zippers.

              

We have ten awesome reward categories that fits your generosity and or needs. Anywhere between USD $1 for a virtual thank you, up to USD $790 for 10 Device Charging Briefcases.  Trust us when when saying WE NEED YOUR HELP AND YOU CAN MAKE A HUGE DIFFERENCE to make this a reality.  If the below categories do not fit your personal needs, perhaps your family, colleagues or friends would love to receive this briefcase as a gift.


Manufacturing

We will be producing in China.  And we have lined up a great manufacturer and a group of world class suppliers.  We are based in China so we have immediate and direct access to our manufactures and suppliers.  Which is convenient, we can be in-house during production to manage Quality Control and making sure we meet our quality standards and timelines.

We have very costly upfront costs ( i.e. raw materials, tooling, and minimum order quantities ) and need your help to meet the upfront capital requirements to begin production.  

Timeline

We have been working tirelessly for one year to bring you the Legion Concepts Device Charging Briefcase; 16 - 18 hr days, 7 days a week.  We are very passionate to deliver a product we and everyone we speak to believes in and needs.  Upon reaching our funding goal of USD $50,000 we will move into production and be on-site in China to provide quality control.  We plan to begin our first shipments between Mid-October and Mid-November.

Legion Concepts Team

We are Legion Concepts. Our team is grouped by people from all over the world.  Our diversified culture keeps our work innovative and active. 


 Michael Bates - Founder & CEO
Michael is an MBA graduate from Rutgers Business School.  He has extensive experience in China and Asia as well as the EMEA region. He formerly worked within the Property Industry and helped MNC's expand operational footprints across the world.

Chris Zhang - Project Manager
Chris is from China and a graduate from Shanghai University of International Business and Economics.  She has experience in multi-cultural environments and worked with the Shanghai Education Bureau and French Consulate General in Shanghai.  

Philip Hanspach - Budget Control Specialist
Philip is a Toulouse School of Economics M.Sc Candidate. He previously organized the Bonn International Model United Nations Conference of 2013 and specializes in Corporate Finance and Industrial Organization.

Special Thanks & Acknowledgement

" If I have seen further than others, it is because I was standing on the shoulders of giants"  -  Issac Newton 

We want to thank our family, friends and creative support for always being there as well as...

Executive Oversight:  Matt Finger, Florian Heiner, Micah Shepard
Design Drawings:  Shirley Zhang
Film Equipment:  Sunny Shen
Video Music Score:  Pawel Walentynski - boomopera
Our Actors & Beta Testers

Risks

After one year creating, improving, and preparing this briefcase, Legion Concepts team is confident to launch a great, functional product into the market.  We have mitigated virtually all risks through out the process, however, there might be unforeseen challenges which may prevent us from delivering the product as previously mentioned. 

1st. MANUFACTURING:  Legion Concepts Charging Briefcase cooperates with over ten suppliers.  A fully functional briefcase requires all the suppliers to operate as scheduled.  If unpredictable issues arise with our suppliers the deliver time could be affected.  However, to avoid this risk, we have also prepared Plan B, and C suppliers and manufacturers.

2nd SHIPPING:  We work with a reliable fulfillment center however unforeseen issues could happen during the delivery process.  To lower the impact, we will buy insurance for every package.

3rd BUDGET:  The Ultimate Device Charging Briefcase is the first crowdfunding campaign of Legion Concepts.  To leave customers a good impression, we selected high quality materials while offering low prices.  We did our best to conclude expense at every phase of the process.  

Press Kit

Download Press Release & Pictures 
Please Visit the Following Link Press Release
If you have further inquiries please contact us at:  info@legionconcepts.com

Please Share Our Campaign

We definitely need everyone's help to make this a big success and we would be very appreciative if you follow us, like, and share with family, friends and colleagues. 

         www.facebook.com/legionconcepts

         @LegionConcepts

          www.linkedin.com/company/legion-concepts

         https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DXmuHzU6K5c

           www.legionconcepts.com

Please Contact Us

If you have questions, comments, concerns or accolades we want to hear from you.  Please contact us:  backers@legionconcepts.com

About Charging

Can you provide more details about the extra slim battery?

Yes, the battery we are using is a Li - polymer lithium-ion battery which has a higher capacity while taking up less space compared to other batteries.  Here are more specifics of the battery:

-Dimension: 15.3 x 7.35 x 1.45 cm ( 6.02 x 2.89 x 0.57 inches )

-Weight: 0.3 kg ( 0.80 lbs )

-Capacity: 10,000 mAh

-Battery: Li - Polymer lithium-ion battery

-Risk Protections: Short circuit protection, Over-power protection, Over-voltage protection, Over-current protection, Over-charge protection, and High temperature protection.

What devices will work with the Charging Briefcase?

Just about all of them; Android, iOS, Windows devices, Nokia 5300, Blackberry, E-reader, MP3, and even PSP.  The USB cable output has a Micro USB head which is compatible with most Android devices.  Meanwhile, the adapters we offer  work with most of Android, iOS,  Windows Devices, Nokia 5300, Blackberry, E-reader, MP3, and PSP.

How many devices can be charged simultaneously?

With two special 2-in-1 USB cables, Legion Concepts offers you to charge three of your devices at the same time.

How many times can my devices be charged?

Different devices have different battery capacities, so it is hard for us to tell you exactly how many times your devices can be charged.  But here is the formula you  can use to calculate:

Charge times = external charger capacity x external battery conversion rate x phone battery health / phone capacity.

Example: for iPhone 5, the capacity is 1,440 mAh; our conversion rate is 0.85, so the charge times is: 10,000 x 0.85 x 0.9 / 1,440 = 5.3 phone charge times ( plus or minus 0.5 - 1 times). 

How does the charging system work?

To keep all the electronics out of sight, we have built an integrated charging system in the bag.  However, the battery and cables are accessible and removable.  You can simply unzip the dedicated charging system section and thread cables through to take them out or replace them.

How can I recharge my briefcase?

You can leave the battery inside the briefcase to recharge.  With a dedicated USB output pocket on the outer shell of the bag, you can simply pull out the USB output cable from the pocket and charge it with whichever USB port you can find, including computer USB port.

How long will the briefcase's battery take to recharge?

About 8-9 hours using a 2 Amp USB charger (Using lower amperage chargers will increase charging time).  However, different charging methods may result in different charging times.  For example, charging from a wall outlet will be faster than charging with a computer USB port.  Environmental temperature, and power flow may also influence the charging time.

About The Briefcase

What size laptops will it accommodate?

Legion Concepts designed the briefcase to accommodate laptops as big as 17’’.  The laptop section dimensions are 40 x 30 x 4 cm ( 15.7 x 11.8 x 1.5 inches).  Meanwhile, to keep smaller laptops safe, we have padded the laptop section with extra padding.  And the stretch material allows you to put bigger computer in it.

What are the dimensions and weight of the Charging Briefcase?

Dimensions: 42 x 32 x 12 cm ( 16.5 x 12.6 x 4.7 inches )

Weight: 1.3 kg ( 3.4 lbs ).

Is the briefcase water resistant?

Yes, we have put a water resistant coating on the 1680 D ballistic nylon outer shell to keep water out.  ( note: water resistant is not water proof ).

How much stuff can I put in the briefcase?

Legion Concepts Charging Briefcase has 4 compartments.  A dedicated computer section is TSA friendly.  There are also numerous pockets to put in different items, such as: three phones pockets ( iPhone 6 Plus or smaller ), one tablet ( iPad Air fits in it ), computer cord, mouse, external hard drive, passport, name cards, airplane tickets, pens and keys.  The middle section in the bag can also accommodate a change of clothes, notebooks, and documents. 

About Shipping

Do I add the shipping fee to the pledge amount or is it charged later?

Please enter your shipping address and the shipping fee will be automatic included.

Do I need to pay for tariff?

For the U.S., our product value is less than 200 USD, so it is less likely to generate a tariff.  For Germany, France and England, there is a chance that there will be a tariff. Example Amount: ( product value x exchange rate – 21 euro ) x 0.2, i.e: ( 100 x 0.8885 – 21 ) x 0.2 = 13.57 euro.  Tariff may differ due to different country custom policies.

Please note that you are solely responsible for any taxes, duties, fees and/or surcharges that your country may impose on the ordered products.

Legal Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."

-Dimension: 15.3 x 7.35 x 1.45 cm ( 6.02 x 2.89 x 0.57 inches )
-Weight: 0.3 kg ( 0.80 lbs )
-Capacity: 10,000 mAh
-Battery: Li - Polymer lithium-ion battery
-Risk Protections: Short circuit protection, Over-power protection, Over-voltage protection, Over-current protection, Over-charge protection, and High temperature protection.
What devices will work with the Charging Briefcase?
Just about all of them; Android, iOS, Windows devices, Nokia 5300, Blackberry, E-reader, MP3, and even PSP.  The USB cable output has a Micro USB head which is compatible with most Android devices.  Meanwhile, the adapters we offer  work with most of Android, iOS,  Windows Devices, Nokia 5300, Blackberry, E-reader, MP3, and PSP.
How many devices can be charged simultaneously?
With two special 2-in-1 USB cables, Legion Concepts offers you to charge three of your devices at the same time.
How many times can my devices be charged?
Different devices have different battery capacities, so it is hard for us to tell you exactly how many times your devices can be charged.  But here is the formula you  can use to calculate:
Charge times = external charger capacity x external battery conversion rate x phone battery health / phone capacity.
Example: for iPhone 5, the capacity is 1,440 mAh; our conversion rate is 0.85, so the charge times is: 10,000 x 0.85 x 0.9 / 1,440 = 5.3 phone charge times ( plus or minus 0.5 - 1 times). 
How does the charging system work?
To keep all the electronics out of sight, we have built an integrated charging system in the bag.  However, the battery and cables are accessible and removable.  You can simply unzip the dedicated charging system section and thread cables through to take them out or replace them.
How can I recharge my briefcase?
You can leave the battery inside the briefcase to recharge.  With a dedicated USB output pocket on the outer shell of the bag, you can simply pull out the USB output cable from the pocket and charge it with whichever USB port you can find, including computer USB port.
How long will the briefcase's battery take to recharge?
About 8-9 hours using a 2 Amp USB charger (Using lower amperage chargers will increase charging time).  However, different charging methods may result in different charging times.  For example, charging from a wall outlet will be faster than charging with a computer USB port.  Environmental temperature, and power flow may also influence the charging time.

About The Briefcase

What size laptops will it accommodate?
Legion Concepts designed the briefcase to accommodate laptops as big as 17’’.  The laptop section dimensions are 40 x 30 x 4 cm ( 15.7 x 11.8 x 1.5 inches).  Meanwhile, to keep smaller laptops safe, we have padded the laptop section with extra padding.  And the stretch material allows you to put bigger computer in it.
What are the dimensions and weight of the Charging Briefcase?
Dimensions: 42 x 32 x 12 cm ( 16.5 x 12.6 x 4.7 inches )
Weight: 1.3 kg ( 3.4 lbs ).
Is the briefcase water resistant?
Yes, we have put a water resistant coating on the 1680 D ballistic nylon outer shell to keep water out.  ( note: water resistant is not water proof ).
How much stuff can I put in the briefcase?
Legion Concepts Charging Briefcase has 4 compartments.  A dedicated computer section is TSA friendly.  There are also numerous pockets to put in different items, such as: three phones pockets ( iPhone 6 Plus or smaller ), one tablet ( iPad Air fits in it ), computer cord, mouse, external hard drive, passport, name cards, airplane tickets, pens and keys.  The middle section in the bag can also accommodate a change of clothes, notebooks, and documents. 

About Shipping

Do I add the shipping fee to the pledge amount or is it charged later?
Please enter your shipping address and the shipping fee will be automatic included.
Do I need to pay for tariff?
For the U.S., our product value is less than 200 USD, so it is less likely to generate a tariff.  For Germany, France and England, there is a chance that there will be a tariff. Example Amount: ( product value x exchange rate – 21 euro ) x 0.2, i.e: ( 100 x 0.8885 – 21 ) x 0.2 = 13.57 euro.  Tariff may differ due to different country custom policies.
Please note that you are solely responsible for any taxes, duties, fees and/or surcharges that your country may impose on the ordered products.

Legal Disclaimer"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."

story:
Fusion Micro Supercomputers: 

The best just got better!

With this amazing product, you can save your documents to Fusion Micro's onboard storage. You can surf the web, check your email, load apps, play games, work from home or office, download songs and videos--everything you need at a price you can more than afford!

Fusion Micro is as ready as you are! Kids, parents, grandparents, teachers, students, artists, inventors, explorers, researchers--no matter how you think of yourself--Fusion Micro will exceed your expectations!

Simply put, Fusion Micro is the world's smallest supercomputer, featuring the latest Intel Cherry Trail Atom chipset for improved graphics performance, faster Wi-Fi with 5ghz speeds. Fusion Micro is customized for the new Windows 10 operating system. And if you like online games, the visual experience Fusion Micro delivers is second to none. Show your friends who's boss as you Big Screen them with MineCraft, World of Warcraft, Diablo, StarCraft, The Sims, and Guild Wars.

                                           Speaking of specs:

                                       What's the CPU?  2.5GHz.

                                    How many cores? Quad core.

            GPU? Intel HD Graphics. (Because you expect the best)

                                             Ram? DDR3L 4GB

                            How about storage? eMMC 32GB/64G

                                   Windows 10 OS? That's right!

                                           Bluetooth? BT 4.0

                                           Wi-Fi? 802.11b/g/n

                                   What's the CPU?  2.5GHz.

                                  How many cores? Quad core.

            GPU? Intel HD Graphics. (Because you expect the best)

                                           Ram? DDR3L 4GB

                          How about storage? eMMC 64GB/64G

                                 Windows 10 OS? That's right!

                                           Bluetooth? BT 4.0

                                  Updated Version has 802.11ac



                                  Fusion Micro Version 3.0

                                   What's the CPU?  2.5GHz.

                                  How many cores? Quad core.

            GPU? Intel HD Graphics. (Because you expect the best)

                                           Ram? DDR3L 4GB

                          How about storage? eMMC 128GB/256GB

                                 Windows 10 OS? That's right!

                                           Bluetooth? BT 4.0

                                  Updated Version has 802.11ac

story:
Short Summary

I built an SMS-based utility called smir.ch. It enables users to search the Web by text message. (Try it free! Text MENU to 908.251.9083)

What We Need & What You Get

The app is 95% completed. It just needs a bit of cleanup and debugging. I've taken it as far as I can with my coding ability, but I now need to hire a developer to do the rest. The app now requires a paid subscription ($4/mo) to use after you reach 5 queries. We're rewarding IndieGoGo sponsors who give $25 or more by providing a free, lifetime subscription to the service!

The Impact

Among the many benefits of smir.ch, the app enables people in regions with limited or no wifi. There are still many people living in regions such as Western Nebraska, New Mexico, and parts of Wyoming, California and Montana who don't have reliable Internet access. Smir.ch brings the richness of the Web to those without it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give to this project, we understand. Please spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social networks you use. Thanks so much for your support! (Try it free! Text MENU to 908.251.9083)

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, my name is Charles.
  • Products that make our homes safer are always needed.

  • Key control adds security for your home. If you are elderly, if you are home alone, if you lost your keys or if you just want to feel safer when you are in your home. Key control is the solution; Key control will stop any key from unlocking your door(s) when you are at home. The dead bolt cannot be unlocked only when you are at home and you are using Key Control.  Unexpected company with a key; use Key Control.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $35,000.00. Funding will be used to transform the prototype into the finished product, change my provisional patent into a regular patent  and manufacture the first production run of Key Control for the public consumer.

If I don’t reach my entire goal, all funding will be used to advance Key Control to its limit.

The Impact

  • Safer; I always want to feel safer; I believe we all want to feel safer. Key Control will make your HOME safer.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot contribute now that is ok, when Key Control becomes available at your favorite store purchase and use it, your purchase will help make Key Control available to more consumers.
  • Remember use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
↑Check out the video↑


Wirelessly connect your Makerbot and Marlin 3D printers to the web


Free Demo


Just 3 clicks to print!

Just upload, choose your printer, and your slicer. The fastest print possible. But this isn't child's play, we give you full control over your slicer settings. The Raspberry Pi is overclocked for performance, so you'll never have printing issues.

As easy as Plug-and-Play

With PrintToPeer, when you first connect your Raspberry Pi to your 3D printer, it just works! The network is automatically configured, your 3D printer is recognized, driver updates are seamlessly integrated, and slicer settings are pre-configured so you are ready to print.


A simple yet powerful interface

PrintToPeer is designed for a beginner, and configured for a pro. We want to make the print process as seamless as possible for when you just want a print to work on the first try. And fast when you have your slice profiles configured.

The maintenance console is a re-imagination of what a print driver could look like. Tutorials will take you through the steps of calibrating your 3D printer, and changing your filament.

With a filament catalog, your settings are shared with the crowd. These include  speed, flow rate and temperature offsets. You no longer need to look up the temperatures required, because filament settings are stored with which printer it was used on. And with ratings, you’ll know which settings have been vetted by the community.


Share your 3D printer with friends

It has never been more important to share 3D printers because the technology is coming into classrooms and offices. Ethernet was made specifically for sharing a printer in an office, so why don’t 3D printers have it? We are hosted on the web, you can easily add another user to your account.


STL files are on the web, your 3D printer should be too

It has never been easier to find free 3D printable objects online in marketplaces like Thingiverse and YouMagine. All you want is to send the design to your 3D printer, but instead you need to process the files on your computer. What if the files were repaired and sliced on the web and sent straight to your 3D printer?


PrintToPeer gives you a web dashboard for your 3D printer that lets you upload STL files, or import them from other web services.


Mobile friendly

You are always on the go, and prints can take a long time, so we know how important it is for your printer to be available from anywhere. Your slicer settings will always be with you, and so will realtime stats.

Notifications


Your 3D printer can send you status updates over SMS or email when your print is finished or if any problems happened during the print.

Monitor your camera remotely

You can watch your print on the web interface from anywhere, all you need is a camera module attached to your Raspberry Pi. If it is a long print and you are concerned it might fail, we can monitor your feed for you and pause the print if anything appears to be unusual. When the print is complete a photo can be automatically shared with your friends.


How it works

Cloud slicing done right, and fast

Performance is important to us. We host Slic3r, Cura, and Makerbot slicers on powerful servers that are always fast and available. So you no longer need to have a beastly computer slicing your files at home. Access your slicer profiles from anywhere and share them with others.


Our database of slicer settings will improve over time, and by tracking failure rates we can offer you the most reliable slicer settings for your specific 3D printer.

Real time, all the time

We knew that there could be no delay for commands and feedback since these are motors we are controlling. PrintToPeer is built with real time websocket communication to give you high resolution data and analytics.

Open source at heart

Open source drives innovation, and we wouldn’t be here without a few key open source projects. So we are giving back to the community by keeping our entire Raspberry Pi codebase open source. We put principles before profit and will be contributing to the success of other projects.

We have taken the same approach as Android, keeping our backend services (queueing, slicing, slice profiles) closed, customizable, and high quality. But with our stretch goal, the server-side code will be open source too!

Secure from the start

Remotely accessing your 3D printer could be a security nightmare, but it's not. From the ground up, all of our connections are made over secure connections using SSL.


Developer-Friendly

Build on top of our platform

The future of 3D printing will be created on top of feature-rich open APIs. We built PrintToPeer to be developer-friendly so you can build on top of our platform. This is new territory, and we are excited to see what you create.

A common API for all 3D printers

You shouldn’t need to know how endstops work to integrate 3D printing in your application. We have abstracted away the lower level details of the different printing processes, so that you can send an object to a generalized 3D printer.

Adding wireless 3D printing to your apps is easy

With a simple RESTful or WebSocket based API, a PrintToPeer user can 3D print right from your apps. You can query which printers are connected with which filament, send objects to the printer

Get early access

Sign up at printtopeer.io/developer to get early access to the PrintToPeer API so you can start building apps for 3D printers.


Proven to Print

Here's what people are saying

“This is the way of the future. The missing piece of the puzzle in 3D printing” - Jean Le Bouthillier, Boots Industries

"So I gave it a shot today, got it all setup and love the maintenance mode as it was nice and fast. Overall I really like the interface and design you guys have come up with." - Ryan Jennings, FormLi

“Designers want to design, not deal with files. The PrintToPeer interface allows designers to get back to doing what they do best.  Fire and Forget: sending a design to a printer then moving on to the next iteration.  In my view a software platform like this is a critical component to mass adoption.” - Bryan Allen, Smith|Allen Studio


What's already built, and what's next?

We’ve spent the past year building our core technology, including our Raspberry Pi software and backend services, and we now support cloud slicing, queueing, and printing. With your help, our next step is to get our software into the hands of as many people as possible, improve compatibility with your 3D printers, and add more features (like automatic mesh repair, guided walkthroughs for tasks like bed leveling, and a more fully-featured API).


Partnership with 3D Hubs

From all of your feedback we know that everyone with a 3D printer prints for other people. Today we are excited to announce that 3D Hubs will be integrating our API so that the process of accepting print jobs is streamlined.

3D Hubs lets people in your area discover your 3D printing capability, handles file uploads and payments, and even repairs the files for you. With our API integration, your favorite slice profiles will accurately price your prints, then prints can be sent directly into your print queue for automatic slicing and approval. How easy is that?!

Anyone can sign up today at http://www.3dhubs.com/ and the integration will take place this summer, after the campaign is complete. If this is something that you value, please support our campaign to make distributed manufacturing accessible.


Crowdsourced Sculpture

In September, we built the world's first crowdsourced 3D printed sculpture with your help. You mailed us 1600 3D printed pieces from around the world, and the result was spectacular. By backing our $10 tier, your logo will be included in this sculpture.



Frequently Asked Questions

What do I get with my lifetime subscription?

You’ll get a personal PrintToPeer account that allows you to connect and operate as many Raspberry Pis and printers as you want. That includes unlimited queueing, slicing, and new features as we add them.


Why should I pay if it is open source?

Your support pays for more than just the Raspberry Pi software - it’s also a lifetime subscription to our backend services (server costs for cloud-hosted slicing and STL repair service), which means you don’t need a beefy desktop next to your printer anymore. It also helps us build our open developer API, and helps us contribute to the future of 3D printing.


Specifically, what parts of PrintToPeer are open source?

Everything that communicates with your printer, and everything that runs inside of your network, is open source. That includes the Raspian-derived linux distro that we ship on the SD cards, and all of the software running on it. 

With our stretch goal, the server-side software will be released as open source as well. More details will be released when this stretch goal is reached.


Isn’t doing everything through the Internet slower than just using USB?

Surprisingly, no! Because we do slicing on dedicated, highly-optimized cloud servers, we can actually slice things faster than the average home computer can. And since it is closer to the source of STL files, the downloads and slicing happen incredible fast. We use websockets for communication with 3D printers, and in real-world testing the round-trip is barely noticeable (see if you can see it in the video).


What if I don’t have a very good internet connection?

PrintToPeer is designed to work with any kind of Internet connection, even the really bad ones. The entire print’s GCode is downloaded to the Pi before printing starts, so if you lose your internet connection mid-print, there’s no risk of print failure.


Why do I need to buy special hardware when my printer already works fine?

Most 3D printers don’t have Ethernet or WiFi, only USB. That’s why PrintToPeer needs the Raspberry Pi -- it connects your printers to the Internet, so we can give you cloud slicing and an API. We’re very comfortable with the Raspberry Pi as a platform, as they’re common, inexpensive, and well-liked, especially among the 3D printing community. If you already have a Raspberry Pi sitting around, you don’t even have to buy any new hardware!


Will I lose my favorite power-user functionality?

No! We’re working hard to ensure that everything you can do in Repetier / ReplicatorG / MakerWare, you can still do with PrintToPeer - but from anywhere, and with an open API. All those settings and tweaks from your favorite slicer are still there, and you can still customize everything to your heart’s content.


Does the camera monitoring use computer vision?

Not yet. We plan to pull a photo of your print every 10 slices and we will watch a feed of all of these images. If the print appears to be failing, we will pause the print and send you a notification. In the future we hope to implement an automated solution with computer vision.

We built PrintToPeer to be developer-friendly so you can build on top of our platform. This is new territory, and we are excited to see what you create.A common API for all 3D printersYou shouldn’t need to know how endstops work to integrate 3D printing in your application. We have abstracted away the lower level details of the different printing processes, so that you can send an object to a generalized 3D printer.Adding wireless 3D printing to your apps is easyWith a simple RESTful or WebSocket based API, a PrintToPeer user can 3D print right from your apps. You can query which printers are connected with which filament, send objects to the printerGet early accessSign up at printtopeer.io/developer to get early access to the PrintToPeer API so you can start building apps for 3D printers.Proven to PrintHere's what people are saying“This is the way of the future. The missing piece of the puzzle in 3D printing” - Jean Le Bouthillier, Boots Industries"So I gave it a shot today, got it all setup and love the maintenance mode as it was nice and fast. Overall I really like the interface and design you guys have come up with." - Ryan Jennings, FormLi“Designers want to design, not deal with files. The PrintToPeer interface allows designers to get back to doing what they do best.  Fire and Forget: sending a design to a printer then moving on to the next iteration.  In my view a software platform like this is a critical component to mass adoption.” - Bryan Allen, Smith|Allen StudioWhat's already built, and what's next?We’ve spent the past year building our core technology, including our Raspberry Pi software and backend services, and we now support cloud slicing, queueing, and printing. With your help, our next step is to get our software into the hands of as many people as possible, improve compatibility with your 3D printers, and add more features (like automatic mesh repair, guided walkthroughs for tasks like bed leveling, and a more fully-featured API).Partnership with 3D Hubs
From all of your feedback we know that everyone with a 3D printer prints for other people. Today we are excited to announce that 3D Hubs will be integrating our API so that the process of accepting print jobs is streamlined.3D Hubs lets people in your area discover your 3D printing capability, handles file uploads and payments, and even repairs the files for you. With our API integration, your favorite slice profiles will accurately price your prints, then prints can be sent directly into your print queue for automatic slicing and approval. How easy is that?!Anyone can sign up today at http://www.3dhubs.com/ and the integration will take place this summer, after the campaign is complete. If this is something that you value, please support our campaign to make distributed manufacturing accessible.Crowdsourced SculptureIn September, we built the world's first crowdsourced 3D printed sculpture with your help. You mailed us 1600 3D printed pieces from around the world, and the result was spectacular. By backing our $10 tier, your logo will be included in this sculpture.Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat do I get with my lifetime subscription?You’ll get a personal PrintToPeer account that allows you to connect and operate as many Raspberry Pis and printers as you want. That includes unlimited queueing, slicing, and new features as we add them.Why should I pay if it is open source?Your support pays for more than just the Raspberry Pi software - it’s also a lifetime subscription to our backend services (server costs for cloud-hosted slicing and STL repair service), which means you don’t need a beefy desktop next to your printer anymore. It also helps us build our open developer API, and helps us contribute to the future of 3D printing.Specifically, what parts of PrintToPeer are open source?Everything that communicates with your printer, and everything that runs inside of your network, is open source. That includes the Raspian-derived linux distro that we ship on the SD cards, and all of the software running on it. With our stretch goal, the server-side software will be released as open source as well. More details will be released when this stretch goal is reached.Isn’t doing everything through the Internet slower than just using USB?Surprisingly, no! Because we do slicing on dedicated, highly-optimized cloud servers, we can actually slice things faster than the average home computer can. And since it is closer to the source of STL files, the downloads and slicing happen incredible fast. We use websockets for communication with 3D printers, and in real-world testing the round-trip is barely noticeable (see if you can see it in the video).What if I don’t have a very good internet connection?PrintToPeer is designed to work with any kind of Internet connection, even the really bad ones. The entire print’s GCode is downloaded to the Pi before printing starts, so if you lose your internet connection mid-print, there’s no risk of print failure.Why do I need to buy special hardware when my printer already works fine?Most 3D printers don’t have Ethernet or WiFi, only USB. That’s why PrintToPeer needs the Raspberry Pi -- it connects your printers to the Internet, so we can give you cloud slicing and an API. We’re very comfortable with the Raspberry Pi as a platform, as they’re common, inexpensive, and well-liked, especially among the 3D printing community. If you already have a Raspberry Pi sitting around, you don’t even have to buy any new hardware!Will I lose my favorite power-user functionality?No! We’re working hard to ensure that everything you can do in Repetier / ReplicatorG / MakerWare, you can still do with PrintToPeer - but from anywhere, and with an open API. All those settings and tweaks from your favorite slicer are still there, and you can still customize everything to your heart’s content.Does the camera monitoring use computer vision?Not yet. We plan to pull a photo of your print every 10 slices and we will watch a feed of all of these images. If the print appears to be failing, we will pause the print and send you a notification. In the future we hope to implement an automated solution with computer vision.

story:
Heritage BC is a not for profit, charitable organization supporting heritage conservation across British Columbia through education, training and skills development, capacity building in heritage planning and funding through the Heritage Legacy Endowment Fund. 
We are passionate about building links between heritage conservation and tourism, economic and environmental sustainability, community pride and an appreciation of our common history.

What We Need

We need $2500 to replace a stolen laptop and projector. 

On Saturday, June 13, 2015  the staff and board spent a sunny summer day together to develop a new 3 year Strategic Plan for Heritage BC.  It was a wildly productive and exciting day. Sadly, at 1:00 a.m. our office was broken into and a laptop and projector were stolen. 

We are a small team (2 FT, 1 PT staff and a student starting in July). We have limited resources and restricted funding.   An extra $2500 is not in the budget! 
The Impact

Both of these pieces of equipment are used for our Training and Skills Development Program which includes:

    • Province wide delivery of training and skills development programming for heritage commission volunteers and non profit heritage groups particularly in remote and smaller communities across British Columbia
    • Custom designed workshops to meet specific community needs 
    • Webinars for volunteers that reach a broad and diverse group but are less structured to specific community needs.  
    • Training topics include “How to Set up a Heritage Register”, “How to Write a Statement of Significance”, “Heritage 101”, “Community Heritage Values” and we also offer Board and volunteer capacity training for non profits within the heritage sector 
    • Delivery of training and skills development workshops specifically on best practices in heritage conservation are offered to the general public through trade shows, demonstrations, events, tours, etc. 

Community Benefit

Bringing heritage conservation top of mind by increasing the capacity of heritage commission volunteers and subsequently their municipalities, individuals, politicians and non profits about the benefits and links of heritage conservation; adding capacity to the non profit heritage sector.  Linking environmental benefits, community pride, history education and cultural values to diverse community members.

Accessibility

Low or no fee for public events and training sessions for volunteers; travel assistance and workshop fee support. 

Community Support

Since 2003 when the BC Heritage Trust was dismantled and subsequently in 2013 when the BC Heritage Branch of the government stopped offering free training and heritage advice, the need for community training and skills development has increased dramatically. Through on line and telephone surveys we have learned there is a desperate need for training and skills development for volunteer and non profit heritage supporters, particularly in remote communities where there are less resources and less local capacity.  Heritage BC has the in house ability to deliver training through low cost webinars and by attending and/or holding training events in communities around the province to support and maintain local cultural and built heritage. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone is able to contribute cash, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please promote our campaign to your friends
  • Please share contacts that may be willing to donate new or refurbished equipment (info@heritagebc.ca)

Visit our website at www.heritagebc.ca to learn more about our programs and services.

story:
"Why Can't We?"

"See how fast the cars are going in our video".  A lifelong obsession for speed and the eternal question of "Why Can't We?" has taken us down the path of creating a simple way to check the speed of objects using video.  What started as a way to figure out how fast race cars are going at different parts of the track has evolved into a technology with thousands of potential uses.  Our first application will be released in March 2015 and allow any IOS or Android device user to video a racecar during a Nascar, Formula 1 or IndyCar race and see how fast they are going without telemetry from the cars or the use of Radar/Laser instrumentation.

The Team:

  • Jay Sterrett, Over 30 years creatively developing new ideas with Siemens, Citrix, Oracle and many others, including Application Server and Global Spend Analytics platforms.  Patents & Applications include "A Process for Calculating the Speed of an Object through use of a Video Frame Sequence".
  • Richard Alan Peters, the principal architect of Neocortex. Alan is also an Associate Professor of Electrical Engineering at Vanderbilt University where he supervises research on a humanoid robot, ISAC, in the Intelligent Robotics Laboratory. He has over fifty publications and has secured research funding in excess of $4 Million.  His image processing lectures have been downloaded by over 100,000 engineers worldwide. His academic work has been in four different areas: signal and image processing, mathematical morphology, electromagnetic scattering, and sensory-guided robotics.
  • Nguyen Nguyen, Systems architect of Video Camera Array systems and management of development process for image processing tools including feature corner detection and image stabilization.


We are looking for Design Ideas as well as Funding

  • The funding is important to pay for additional programming to refine the app, but equally important are ideas on what other uses exist for this technology.  Every time I talk to someone about what we are doing, they come up with another use that we haven't thought of.  Please help us find the best uses for the technology and also to prioritize our development efforts.
  • We are creating a Beta Group that will get first releases of each app developed and also will be responsible for determining the future direction of the company!
  • All monies raised during this funding will go to programming development of the app.  The amount of the funding is the budget assessment for programming effort between now and March 2015.  Any shortage in funding will be made up by the team, so the app will go forward as scheduled no matter what.

Racing Fans

I know that our first app is geared towards fun.  I am one of the 650 million auto racing fans worldwide.  This may seem like just another fun app that we have on our phones, but the implication of the technology includes many other uses.  A few that have been mentioned are; Coaching Aid for Sports, Forensic Analysis and Horse Training.

How does it work?

The app uses Object Detection and Background Segmentation to track the moving car through the video.  Then, within thresholds defined by the Library, it determines scale and combines that with the video tracking to determine speed!  SIMPLE!


Most of all, we need your help to get the word out:

Nascar, Formula 1 and IndyCar forums

Video App forums

Facebook

LinkedIn

Friends

Relatives

People you don't even like!


Speed Racer ™ is a trademark of John Sterrett

Copyright
Copyright [2014] John Sterrett. All Rights Reserved. All text, images, graphics, animation, videos, music and other materials on this page to the copyright and other intellectual property rights of John Sterrett. These materials may not be reproduced, distributed, modified or reposted to other websites without the express written permission of John Sterrett.

story:
Short Summary

Many of the refugee students in Utica don't have an opportunity to play organized soccer, due in large part to a lack of funds for equipment, registration fees and transportation. 

Did you know it costs over $900 to register a team of 10 for an indoor session? It's almost $500 more if you want a few hours of practice time on a field, and those numbers don't include costs for shinguards, jerseys or cleats. Outdoor league team registration is slightly less (usually between $100 and $300) but referee fees can be over $100 per game!

By donating to this cause you will be enabling refugee students and students from low-income families to enjoy the game they love, feel connected to others and their community, and feel as if they have found a home, not just a place to live or survive. 

What We Need 

  • Soccer balls 
  • Cleats, shinguards & tee shirts (for at least 15 girls & 15 boys)
  • Outdoor team registration fees for one girls team and one boys team 
  • Referee fees for approximately 8 games per team
  • Player pass fees (approximately $10 per player)
  • Club insurance costs (TBD)

Full disclosure: I will be reaching out to community organizations for donations (both monetary and non-monetary). If I do not need full funding for the upcoming league sessions, any extra funds will be saved for the next session.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out to others!!! Also, I'll keep people posted on when and where the kids are playing- come support them in person!
