story:
The 911 Phone™ allows any unused old cell phone to be placed in the home as a dedicated phone line to reach 911 in the event of an emergency.

Best of all with The 911 Phone there are no phone subscription to pay; all calls to 911 are free and there are no carrier fees, monthly fees, subscriber fees, yearly fees, landline fees or any cost to use the phone. This is possible because in the U.S., FCC rules require telephone carriers to connect 9-1-1 calls from any cell phone, regardless of whether that phone is currently active.

The 911 Phone is specially designed to look like a home phone and is conveniently placed in the home and is wall or desk mounted.

In the event of an emergency The 911 Phone is easy to locate by children, seniors and others in the home where every second counts. The 911 Phone always stays on; is charged and works even in a power outage.

Many people who look at The 911 Phone simply say that they have a cell phone and so do others in their household so why would they need this product. The answer is that in the event of an emergency every second counts and is critical in saving a life. Different scenarios include people usually put phone at different locations in the home and in an emergency they tend to panic and forget where their cell phone was placed; or forgot that their cell phone is in the car, office or other location. Other scenarios include low or dead battery; weak signal caused by low battery or phone is not accessible by children, elderly family members or others in the home.

The 911 Phone is similar to having a home fire extinguisher, first-aid kit, smoke detectors or other inexpensive safety fixtures in the home. They generally do not move and you know where they are located, in the event of an emergency.

Benefits

• No Contracts

• No Monthly Fees

• No Service Fees

• No Landline Needed

• Works in Power Outages

• Find Phone Easily in an Emergency

• Never Worry About Low or Dead Battery

• Works with any Cell Phone


The Prototype Process

To make a fully functioning working prototype we first had to get an engineer to design our product from the few computer visuals we provided him with. From this he produced 3D CAD (computer-aided design) images that allowed us to see the product on the computer in a three dimensional way. We made changes and the process went back and fourth until we were satisfied with its overall appearance, size and shape. During this time frame we also filed a patent application with the United States Patent and Trademark Office to seek protection on our product.  

The next process was to bring our three dimensional images to life and make a real part that we could have in our hand to test. We found a local company in South Florida that specializes with prototypes to help us. In only a few days the prototype was made using high grade ABS plastic through a 3D Rapid Prototyping process.

Our prototype has brought The 911 Phone to real life and allowed us to test the overall look and functionality of the product; how it feels; how much it weighs; the dimensions; the overall aesthetics and to test how different cell phones work with the product.

The case size is 7.5 inches height by 2.75 inches width and this ideal size was determined after careful research of all the different current and past cell phone models. This insures that our product will work with the majority of cell phones in circulation.

Since the cell phone in the case is always plugged into wall charger, the case has an opening on bottom (for phones that charger plugs into top or bottom) as well as push out tabs on side of case (for phones that charge from the sides). For prototype we made 1 tab on each side of case but after in depth testing with over 200 cell phones (new and old), we added another tab on side and adjusted the spacing of tabs to accommodate the various plug placement.

Phone is easily placed and removed from case with the use of Velcro (placed on back of phone and inside case). This allows the phone to easily be removed in the event of an emergency.

Photos of Prototype



Case Closed (wall mounted)



Case Opened (angle view)



Case Opened (front view)



Case Closed (side view)



Case has push out tabs for phones with side charging port



Cell phone in case



Taking cell phone out of case



Cell phone out of case ready to be used in emergency



Phone is easily placed and removed from case using Velcro



Case closed with cell phone inside (front view)



Another cell phone in case



Another cell phone out of case ready to be used in emergency



Phone is easily placed and removed from case using Velcro



Case closed with cell phone inside (angle view)



Another cell phone in case (angle view)



Another cell phone in case with view of phone charger plugged into wall



Case closed with cell phone inside with view of phone charger plugged into wall



Prototype going through testing in a local cell phone shop

Early Stage Photos

In designing The 911 Phone we started with the idea that the case that houses the emergency cell phone should resemble a house telephone casing.



We complied a lot of homephones to take measurements and compare case sizing and features.



Narrowed down search to a few slimline designs and took phones apart to examine.



Mock up version of case that was used to create computer instructions.



Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product for engineer to design. (slide 1)



Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product for engineer to design. (slide 2)



Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product for engineer to design. (slide 3)


Product Specs and CAD Drawing/Renderings



Product Specs Drawing



3D CAD Drawing (Angle 1) Final Revision



3D CAD Drawing (Angle 2) Final Revision



3D CAD Drawing (Angle 3) Final Revision



Product will also be available in blue and red finishes. (CAD Rendering) Final Revision


Interesting Statistics

• On average, American cell phone subscribers replace their cell phones every 18 months. In the U.S., between 100 million and 130 million cell phones are thrown away each year, representing an estimated 65,000 tons of electronics waste.

• More than half of U.S. homes do not have landline phone service.

• An estimated 240 million calls are made to 9-1-1 in the U.S. each year. According to the FCC, one-third are wireless calls; in many communities, it’s one-half or more of all 9-1-1 calls.


The Production Process

The 911 Phone finished product will be made of polypropylene (pp) plastic.The world of plastic is not a cut and dried one. There are around 45 different types of plastic and each one has its own properties and uses, from commercial to residential. Polypropylene is a durable plastic that is used in a wide range of commercial products found in the marketplace, due to its wide variety of benefits.

To manufacture finished units of The 911 Phone a mold must be fabricated. We have shopped around with many vendors in the U.S. to not only find a mold maker but also a company that will handle production of the product for us. After many quotes, we found a company in our own area (South Florida), where we can drive to and meet at their office/warehouse and be hands on with our product. This company has over 25 years of experience in making molds and in the production of finished products. They have a partnership with a company in China that allows them to offer the low manufacturing costs of oversees production while also offering the personalized service found locally.

The most expensive part of any product production is tooling. This is the initial investment to make the product mold where all units will be made from and is made from steel. It is estimated that it will take 30 - 45 days to complete the mold for The 911 Phone and will cost $14,200 to produce. With this mold we are guaranteed by the company that it will be durable and able to produce a few hundred thousand units during the life cycle of the mold.



For any product found in the marketplace a mold must first be made. The above example is a mold made for the production of car door handles.



After the mold is completed, the production of The 911 Phone units will take place. This is done using injection molding which is the most commonly used manufacturing process for the fabrication of plastic parts. Raw plastic material is melted in an injection molding machine and injected into the mold, where it cools and solidifies into the final part.

The minimum number of units that we need to start production is 2,500 units and the total cost to do this $7,300. The manufacturer estimates that it will take 25 - 40 days to produce the units and another 3 weeks to be shipped from China to Miami.

Indiegogo Campaign

Now it’s time to raise the funds ($26,500) to bring The 911 Phone product to life. To start production, we need to produce the mold ($14,200); a minimum of 2,500 units ($7,300) and we are offering FREE SHIPPING worldwide ($5,000) to our Indiegogo backers, but we don’t have the funds to do that by ourselves. This is where you come in. Please be our partner.

Breakdown:

• Product Mold ($14,200)
• Minimum order of 2,500 units ($7,300)
• Free Shipping of product to Indiegogo backers ($5,000)

Total: $26,500

We have a precise timeline of when we will receive the finished product from our manufacturer. We will be ready to ship out all orders immediately. We are certain that no matter how many orders we get, we will be able to deliver on schedule.

From the product engineering, product mold, product production, manufacturer to the shipping, everything is lined up and ready to go. We have taken every step we can to make sure that The 911 Phone is delivered to your door as fast as possible. Now all we need is your help.


Timelines Challenges

With every new project in life comes goals, timelines and deadlines to meet. We also know that nothing in life is certain and there with always be challenges and obstacles along the way.

That being said we are confident that we have done our due diligence in learning the production process and everything we can about the product we want to produce and offer to the public. We are also confident that we are using an experienced and well respected company for the product mold and final product production.

A few of the challenges that could present itself are:

• Mold price could potentially go up slightly due to higher steel cost. (The quote we got is for now and when the project is finally funded it might change slightly.)

• Production could potentially goes up slightly due to higher plastic cost. (The quote we got is for now and when the project is finally funded it might change slightly.)

• There might be small delays in producing the mold in 30 - 45 days; final production of units in 25 - 40 days; shipment coming from China in 3 weeks or all orders going out immediately (2 - 3 weeks) from us to Indiegogo backers.

We are confident that any delays or potential obstacles that do arise will be met by us and we will do whatever in our power to correct.

Timeline:

3/20/14 - Indiegogog funding period begins

5/10/14 - Indiegogo funding period ends

5/19/14 – Start the creation of product mold.

6/19/14 - Start production of first 2,500 units of The 911 Phone.

8/10/14 - Package and mail product to Indiegogo supporters.

We plan on doing whatever it takes to ship by or before 8/31/14

Thank You All For Your Support!

In the event of an emergency The
911 Phone is easy to locate by children, seniors and others in the home where
every second counts. The 911 Phone always stays on; is charged and works even
in a power outage. 
Many people who look at The 911 Phone
simply say that they have a cell phone and so do others in their household so
why would they need this product. The answer is that in the event of an
emergency every second counts and is critical in saving a life. Different
scenarios include people usually put phone at different locations in the
home and in an emergency they tend to panic and forget where their cell phone
was placed; or forgot that their cell phone is in the car, office or other location. Other
scenarios include low or dead battery; weak signal caused by low battery or phone
is not accessible by children, elderly family members or others in the
home.
The 911 Phone is similar to having
a home fire extinguisher, first-aid kit, smoke detectors or other inexpensive safety
fixtures in the home. They generally do not move and you know where they are
located, in the event of an emergency.
Benefits• No Contracts• No Monthly Fees • No Service Fees    
• No Landline Needed
• Works in Power Outages     
• Find Phone Easily in an Emergency
• Never Worry About Low or Dead Battery • Works with any Cell PhoneThe Prototype ProcessTo
 make a fully functioning working prototype we first had to get an 
engineer to design our product from the few computer visuals we provided
 him with. From this he produced 3D CAD (computer-aided design) images 
that allowed us to see the product on the computer in a three 
dimensional way. We made changes and the process went back and fourth 
until we were satisfied with its overall appearance, size and shape. 
During this time frame we also filed a patent application with the 
United States Patent and Trademark Office to seek protection on our 
product.   The next process was to bring our three dimensional 
images to life and make a real part that we could have in our hand to 
test. We found a local company in South Florida that specializes with 
prototypes to help us. In only a few days the prototype was made using 
high
grade ABS plastic through a 3D Rapid Prototyping process.Our prototype has brought The 911 Phone to real life and allowed us to test
the overall look and functionality of the product; how it feels; how much it
weighs; the dimensions; the overall aesthetics and to test how different cell
phones work with the product.The case size is 7.5 inches
height by 2.75 inches width and this ideal size was determined after careful
research of all the different current and past cell phone models. This insures that
our product will work with the majority of cell phones in circulation. 
Since the cell phone in the case
is always plugged into wall charger, the case has an opening on bottom 
(for phones
that charger plugs into top or bottom) as well as push out tabs on side 
of case
(for phones that charge from the sides). For prototype we made 1 tab on 
each side of case but after in depth testing with over 200 cell phones 
(new and old), we added another tab on side and adjusted the spacing of 
tabs to accommodate the various plug placement. 
Phone is easily placed and
removed from case with the use of Velcro (placed on back of phone and inside case). This allows
the phone to easily be removed in the event of an emergency. Photos of PrototypeCase Closed (wall mounted)Case Opened (angle view)Case Opened (front view)Case Closed (side view)
Case has push out tabs for phones with side charging port
Cell phone in case
Taking cell phone out of case
Cell phone out of case ready to be used in emergency
Phone is easily placed and removed from case using Velcro
Case closed with cell phone inside (front view)
Another cell phone in case
Another cell phone out of case ready to be used in
emergency
Phone is easily placed and removed from case using Velcro
Case closed with cell phone inside (angle view)
Another cell phone in case (angle view)
Another cell phone in case with view of phone charger
plugged into wall
Case closed with cell phone inside with view of phone
charger plugged into wall
Prototype going through testing in a local cell phone
shopEarly Stage PhotosIn designing The 911 Phone we started with the idea that the case that houses the emergency cell phone should resemble a house telephone casing.
We complied a lot of homephones to take measurements and
compare case sizing and features.Narrowed down search to a few slimline designs and took
phones apart to examine.
Mock up version of case that was used to create computer
instructions.
Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product
for engineer to design. (slide 1)
Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product
for engineer to design. (slide 2)
Mock up instructions that were made to illustrate product
for engineer to design. (slide 3)Product Specs and CAD Drawing/Renderings
Product Specs Drawing
3D CAD Drawing (Angle 1) Final Revision
3D CAD Drawing (Angle 2) Final Revision
3D CAD Drawing (Angle 3) Final Revision
Product will also be available in blue and red finishes.
(CAD Rendering) Final Revision
Interesting Statistics• On average, American cell phone subscribers replace their cell 
phones every 18 months. In the U.S., between 100 million and 130 million
 cell phones are thrown away each year, representing an estimated 65,000
 tons of electronics waste.• More than half of U.S. homes do not have landline phone service.•
 An estimated 240 million calls are made to 9-1-1 in the U.S. each year.
 According to the FCC, one-third are wireless calls; in many 
communities, it’s one-half or more of all 9-1-1 calls. The Production ProcessThe 911 Phone finished product will be made of polypropylene (pp) plastic.The world of plastic is not a cut
and dried one. There are around 45 different types of plastic and each one has
its own properties and uses, from commercial to residential. Polypropylene is
a durable plastic that is used in a wide range of commercial products found in the marketplace, due to its
wide variety of benefits.To manufacture finished units of The 911 Phone
 a mold must be fabricated. We have shopped around with many vendors in 
the U.S. to not only find a mold maker but also a company that will 
handle production of the product for us. After many quotes, we found a 
company in our own area (South Florida), where we can drive to and meet 
at their office/warehouse and be hands on with our product. This company
 has over 25 years of experience in making molds and in the production 
of finished products. They have a partnership with a company in China 
that allows them to offer the low manufacturing costs of oversees 
production while also offering the personalized service found locally.The
 most expensive part of any product production is tooling. This is the 
initial investment to make the product mold where all units will be made
 from and is made from steel. It is estimated that it will take 30 - 45 
days to complete the mold for The 911 Phone and will cost $14,200
 to produce. With this mold we are guaranteed by the company that it 
will be durable and able to produce a few hundred thousand units during 
the life cycle of the mold.
For any product found in the marketplace a mold must
first be made. The above example is a mold made for the production of car door
handles.
After the mold is completed, the production of The 911 Phone 
units will take place. This is done using injection molding which is the
 most
commonly used manufacturing process for the fabrication of plastic 
parts. Raw
plastic material is melted in an injection molding machine and injected 
into the mold, where it cools and solidifies into the final part.The
 minimum number of units that we need to start production is 2,500 units
 and the total cost to do this $7,300. The manufacturer estimates that 
it will take 25 - 40 days to produce the units and another 3 weeks to be
 shipped from China to Miami. Indiegogo CampaignNow it’s time to raise the funds ($26,500) to bring The 911 Phone product
 to life. To start production, we need to produce the mold ($14,200); a 
minimum of
 2,500 units ($7,300) and we are offering FREE SHIPPING worldwide 
($5,000) to our Indiegogo backers, but we don’t have the funds to do 
that by
 ourselves. This is where you come in. Please be our partner.Breakdown:• Product Mold ($14,200)• Minimum order of 2,500 units ($7,300)• Free Shipping of product to Indiegogo backers ($5,000)Total: $26,500We
 have a precise timeline of when we will receive the finished product 
from our manufacturer. We will be ready to ship out all orders 
immediately. We are certain that no matter how many orders we get, we 
will be able to deliver on schedule. From the product 
engineering, product mold, product production, manufacturer to the 
shipping, everything is lined up and ready to go. We have taken every 
step we can to make sure that The 911 Phone is delivered to your door as fast as possible. Now all we need is your help.Timelines Challenges With every new project in life comes goals, timelines and deadlines 
to meet. We also know that nothing in life is certain and there with 
always be challenges and obstacles along the way.
That being said we are confident that we have done our due diligence 
in learning the production process and everything we can about the 
product we want to produce and offer to the public. We are also 
confident that we are using an experienced and well respected company 
for the product mold and final product production. 
A few of the challenges that could present itself are:
• Mold price could potentially go up slightly due to higher steel 
cost. (The quote we got is for now and when the project is finally 
funded it might change slightly.)
• Production could potentially goes up slightly due to higher plastic
 cost. (The quote we got is for now and when the project is finally 
funded it might change slightly.)
• There might be small delays in producing the mold in 30 - 45 days; 
final production of units in 25 - 40 days; shipment coming from China in
 3 weeks or all orders going out immediately (2 - 3 weeks) from us to 
Indiegogo backers.
We are confident that any delays or potential obstacles that do arise
 will be met by us and we will do whatever in our power to correct.  
Timeline:
3/20/14 - Indiegogog funding period begins
5/10/14 - Indiegogo funding period ends
5/19/14 – Start the creation of product mold. 
6/19/14 - Start production of first 2,500 units of The 911 Phone.
8/10/14 - Package and mail product to Indiegogo supporters. 
We plan on doing whatever it takes to ship by or before 8/31/14
Thank You All For Your Support!

story:
When Julia Lopez lost his 3 year old son for 30 minutes, it inspiried him to design a mobile device that helps the  parents to "maintain"a connection with his child all the time:SAFEKID.

Cuando Julia López perdió a su hijo de tres años durante 30 minutos, el susto que pasó le inspiró a desarrollar un dispositivo móvil que permitiese a los padres mantenerse "conectados" con sus hijos pequeños en todo momento: SAFEKID.

Safekid is a mobile device with technology bluetooth that helps
control your children by a bracelet.

Safekid es un dispositivo con tecnología bluetooth que controla a tu hijo mediante la pulsera Safekid.

The colourful safekid made for children,is connected by an application in a smartphone and permits control of your children at a safe distance always.

El colorido safekid, hecho para niños, está conectado a una app en el smartphone de sus padres, y permite controlar la distancia de seguridad a la que es aconsejable que esté el niño.

The application advises  the parents by a radio signal and you receive an alert message everytime a child enters or leaves the safe area.

La app permite a los padres establecer un radio de seguridad. Recibir alarmas y avisos cada vez que los pequeños entren o salgan del área establecida.

Safekid is designed for parents of children of 2 to 14 years old the design of the bracelet is so that children have difficulty in losing it because it's attached to your wrist and comes in great colours,cartoons,and different colours.

Safekid está dirigido a niños entre 2 y 14 años. Su forma de pulsera se debe a que los niños de esa edad son propensos a perder las cosas que no están adheridas a sus cuerpos. Las pulseras tendrán distintos colores.

If you do not cooperate economically possible, help us get this wonderful project and spread the campaign via Facebook, Twitter or other social networks.

Si no te resulta posible colaborar económicamente, ayúdanos a conseguir este magnifico proyecto y difunde la campaña vía Facebook, Twitter u otras redes sociales.

story:
DIMPLE is a small sticker or protective case with user-configurable buttons that you attach to the rear side of your Android NFC-enabled gadgets. Buttons can launch apps, change settings, turn on the flashlight and much, much more. You can double the button count by assigning a long-press function.


AVAILABLE COLORS:

DIMPLE STANDARD & MINI PRODUCT WORKS ONLY WITH ANDROID 4.0+ NFC-ENABLED GADGETS (EXCLUDES HTC ONE M7 & M8 and other metal devices), FOR HTC ONE COMPATIBILITY, PLEASE CHOOSE THE PROTECTIVE CASE OPTION.



(Buttons below will not work if you read this on a mobile device)





Attached in close proximity (even over a case) to your device’s NFC reader, DIMPLE lets you extend the functionality to your own liking, from launching your favorite social network app, to launching sophisticated Tasker tasks or your own developed plugins through DIMPLE API.




„If the final product is half as good as it sounds, it's likely to be a big hit.” CNET 

„The DIMPLE goes above and beyond the call of duty with a set of four easy-to-install buttons that can be customized to do almost anything you want.” GIZMODO

„What makes the DIMPLE stand out from solutions like Pressy is that you don’t have to sacrifice anything to use it.” AndroidAuthority

„These days most smartphones only have buttons for the most crucial of tasks. Some of us still prefer having hardware buttons. DIMPLE aims to fill that gap.” Ubergizmo

„DIMPLE.IO is a project that is likely going to make a lot of Android users very happy, because it adds four buttons to your device that you can do whatever you want with.” GEEK


You define your experience with DIMPLE, from controlling what each button will do, to its  placement according to your own ergonomics. DIMPLE is designed to give you total control over its functionality and to fit your personal needs and requirements.

The "One size fits all" approach rarely truly works. We believe that everyone- from the average Joe to power users - should have the ability to customize their gadgets just the way they want them without ever picking up a drill or an axe. We approached the user experience with DIMPLE with the following principles in mind:

Customization should not be intimidating or difficult. This is why we designed DIMPLE to be quick to set up and use right out of the box. The companion app user interface is incredibly easy to understand, even though it packs a lot of advanced features. Application of DIMPLE is super easy, and you have a thingy called "training wheels" to try and feel the best location to apply the dimple. If you have ever applied a sticker without burning a house down, you will be able to apply DIMPLE. If you can use a smartphone, you can use DIMPLE.

Every human is built differently, though we still get to use the same gadgets. Heck, if you are left-handed, you probably sometimes think that the world has turned on you. No more. You can apply the DIMPLE sticker in practically unlimited positions in close proximity to the NFC antenna of your device. For most gadgets, this means all of the rear side; for tablets and phablets- just a part of the rear side. The DIMPLE offers tactile feedback- hear a "click" on every push of a button in addition to haptic feedback. Every button has a patented groove around it with a braille dimple in the middle. Your fingers will be able to distinct each button in any situation. 

Functionality means different things to different people. So we did not want to design a rigid one-solution-fits-everyone product. Instead we spent many months in the dark actually developing an application that will never be finished in a sense of constant evolution. The Beta, which will suit every need of the average user, is already online. We are now working closely with numerous partners to bring a small ecosystem of third party plugins and integrations into some of the world's coolest apps when the product ships.


Don't want to write code? Create some unique Tasker tasks and tie them to our companion app. 

Feel like coding? Welcome, please visit- dimple.io/developers

(The button above will not work on mobile devices)

 



(The button above will not work on mobile devices)


We have been working on this product for the past 18 months and have gone through 12 iterations of prototypes. We feel like we are ready for the market with the current iteration. 


We have manufactured the first mass-production test batch of 250 DIMPLE Beta units. We are trying to address some assembly scaling problems and combat some unwanted adhesive defects. 





(The button above will not work on mobile devices)


Will it work with my device?

Based on our approximations there are currently around 800 devices with which the DIMPLE will work. This sadly excludes HTC One (M7 & M8) because of its metal body. Creating a device out of metal usually requires the engineers to make some sacrifices in terms of antenna location and affects our customers' ability to position DIMPLE ergonomically on a HTC One. So, if your device runs Android 4.0 and above, is not made out of metal, and has NFC technology, you are safe to assume that DIMPLE will work with it.

No HTC One?

Designing a metal body forces engineers to get creative. The result of this creativity is that the NFC antenna is located around the camera ring. You would have to sacrifice the camera to make the DIMPLE work. No cases or covers will solve this.

Can it be reused?

Even though the adhesive used allows for easy removal, each time you remove a DIMPLE from your device's surface, the adhesive properties will deteriorate and that may compromise the longevity of the DIMPLE. You should be fine for at least 5-10 attachments and removals. After that, the DIMPLE may not stick to the surface as well as when it was new. We are exploring options to use adhesive that can be reused as many times as you want, without compromising the thinness of DIMPLE.

Where can I put it?

In close proximity to the NFC antenna of the device. For most gadgets, it means the rear side of the device. For tablets, it means a part of the rear side. 

The only gadget we have yet found to play well with DIMPLE on the front is the Sony Z2 Tablet.

The maximum range (like a really thick case) of how far you can locate the DIMPLE from the reader antenna is around 5 cm (2 in).

How about battery life?

Latest generation NFC reader chips embedded in our gadgets will consume little to no noticeable amounts of your device's battery life. Keeping NFC on should not take away more than 5 minutes of your daily battery life.

How big is it?

49 x 16 x 0.49 mm or 1.92 x 0.66 x 0.019 inches.

Can I use other NFC devices with DIMPLE on my device?

Yes.

Will it work with the screen off?

Currently, due to security concerns, this functionality is disabled in stock Android. We are working closely with the Google Android team to find a way to bring this to the next versions of the operating system. For the time being, you have to root your device and install the xposed framework.

Will it work with my case?

DIMPLE can be attached directly to your case instead of to the surface of your device. Unless the case is made out of metal, you should be fine.

How about accidental triggering?

We have engineered the buttons impossible to be pressed unintentionally. The buttons are flush with the surface of the DIMPLE.

How long will it last?

If you applied the DIMPLE carefully, the adhesive should outlast your gadget upgrade cycle. Our tests have concluded that each button can withstand about 2 million clicks, and you can reassign the functionality of around 100,000 times before the button memory wears out.

story:
The Shuteye was born from an article I read that casually told me the most recent threat to our privacy are hackers who can easily access the webcam in laptops, phones, and more recently TV's whenever they wanted!

I don't know about you, but to me, privacy in my own home is priceless, and to think that these people could basically have their own camera in my home was unacceptable, and a little creepy. I mean think about it, how many times have you danced around the house in your under shorts dancing to Gangnam Style?

Errr, well I don't, but I'm sure there are people who have done that. Anyway, the article offered no solution to this new discovery, and a Google search yielded bulky, and impractical ways of solving the problem. The Shuteye solves all of these problems in one simple and cost effective solution. Its adhesive backing makes install a breeze, and of course leaves no residue when it's taken off. You simply slide the tab over the lense when you aren't using the camera, and slide it back when you are. The best thing is, you can still close your laptop with it on!

The money you invest will be used to set up the die press with a local company to mass produce these for distribution, pay for packaging design, marketing and a website.

They will be made from high-quality durable plastic and you can order the Shuteye in grey or white. Specific colors and designs are also available for an additional charge.

Contribute to the cause and get your very own Shuteye! Guess what, they are just $5!, That's right, and it includes shipping! I repeat, you can have the Shuteye for $5 delivered to your door! That's like the cost of a gallon of gas nowadays. But like I said, this is about privacy and helping others with a smart and simple idea. So get the Shuteye for yourself, get one for a friend, or your children, and especially those people who are doing the Gangnam Style in their undies! Help spread the word so that we can make this affordable for everyone, Thank you so much for your help!

-Steve

Anyway, the article offered no solution to this new discovery, and a Google search yielded bulky, and impractical ways of solving the problem. The Shuteye solves all of these problems in one simple and cost effective solution.  Its adhesive backing makes install a breeze, and of course leaves no residue when it's taken off. You simply slide the tab over the lense when you aren't using the camera, and slide it back when you are. The best thing is, you can still close your laptop with it on! 

The money you invest will be used to set up the die press with a local company to mass produce these for distribution, pay for packaging design, marketing and a website. 
They will be made from high-quality durable plastic and you can order the Shuteye in grey or white. Specific colors and designs are also available for an additional charge. 
Contribute to the cause and get your very own Shuteye! Guess what, they are just $5!, That's right, and it includes shipping! I repeat, you can have the Shuteye for $5 delivered to your door! That's like the cost of a gallon of gas nowadays. But like I said, this is about privacy and helping others with a smart and simple idea. So get the Shuteye for yourself, get one for a friend, or your children, and especially those people who are doing the Gangnam Style in their undies! Help spread the word so that we can make this affordable for everyone, Thank you so much for your help! 
-Steve

story:
We’re Troy, Dan, Marcie and Adiclere - the names and faces behind ListSanity.com - a small team that has bootstrapped our project to get it on the web. And now we want to bring ListSanity to smart phones so that users can enjoy the full functionality from anywhere.

What’s ListSanity and Why Should It Go Mobile? 

ListSanity is an online platform where you can create, store and share Lists about anything and everything. When other people contribute or vote on your List we take all the versions, add a little math and come up with an authoritative PopuList – so you’ll know who’s right and who’s wrong once and for all. ListSanity is a great way to learn new things about your friends, meet new people with similar interests, or just waste time. 

Since our launch the number one thing we’ve been hearing from our users (well, number two after how awesome ListSanity is) is that they need a mobile version! 

Many of our users share Lists via Twitter – and right now it’s not super easy to see or make Lists via your smartphone. So we want to develop an HTML5 version of our website that can be downloaded to any smartphone (Android, iOs, Windows, RIM) and used on the go. The mobile app will let you get notifications about changes to your Lists, challenges or even create new Lists that have pressing importance (What color shirt should I wear on my first date?) With a mobile app you’ll even be able to store Lists for everyday use – think grocery Lists or to-do Lists. But mostly, it’s about the fun you can have making Lists about everything else. 

What if we raise more money than we need? 

After we celebrate and of course complete the mobile app our next project is the Facebook app.  We believe that ListSanity will see crazy growth if users don’t have to leave Facebook to do a List.  Any extra funding over our goal will go to the development of a ListSanity Facebook App.

What if we raise less money than we need?

We hope that's not the case but if it is ... we will start with two cans and a string and try to get the mobile app done....but it might take a really really long time. 

Our Team has the experience to make it a reality.

We can really do it ourselves! One of our founders is a designer with mobile app experience (Marcie) and another is a developer with mobile app experience (Dan). We don't have to go out and find someone to do this who might try and hold us over a barrel for more money. We're committed to doing it ourselves and getting it done quickly. Unfortunately, none of us are independently wealthy, so we just need the money so that the programing team can give up some paying gigs to get this done. 

We’ve laid out a realistic development roadmap that will help us get the project out the door and on to your phone. Most importantly, this project is near and dear to our hearts, because this is what the people want – the sooner we finish the mobile app the sooner we can make everyone happy and move on to other parts of the project that are keeping us awake at night. 

What more info? 

For updates and a little flavor of our team personality check out our blog at www.listsanity.com/info. If you’re interested in some more specifics about what we intend to offer in the mobile app it’ll help if you first head on over to our website and check it out. Then visit our info page for a development roadmap that gives you a breakdown of how we’re building the app and what you can expect. 

Challenges

The greatest challenge with creating the mobile app is controlling feature creep to keep development on track. We know that we can't have all the features out of the gate so the goal will be to prioritize those that we believe are most important to the basic functionality of the site while giving users enough to satisfy their ListSanity fix.

We plan on locking down our dev roadmap before we begin building the app. We've spent a lot of time thinking about features based on user feedback and we're confident that we'll be able to come up with a spec that we'll be happy to carry throughout the project.

Should a feature arise that the team agrees is truly necessary to add after we've locked our feature set, Dan will take time from his other projects to focus on meeting our initial goals. If that's not a possibility we'll reevaluate the features to see if the new feature can replace one that hasn't yet been developed.

Hopefully these aren't really a concern. We've all worked on enough projects that we know feature creep is the enemy of the productive. We're pretty set on getting something to market as quickly as possible (for example, look at the quick two and a half months it took to get our open beta for the website).

Either way, we'll keep you updated on our blog and via messages if there are real problems! No one wants this mobile app as much as we do!

About this project
More and more automobiles into the public life, the calls to drive a serious impact on driving safety, normal Bluetooth headset power is not enough, easy to get lost. Growing smart phones, tablet PCs need to be more frequent charging. Emergency need safety hammer smashed car glass to escape. We carry a product to meet all the needs of the above, we hope to everyone's support.

What is this product?
This is a hammer safety ，car charger and Bluetooth Headset .

What is the features of this product?

1 Firstly, it is a Bluetooth headset, and easy to use.

Bluetooth headset for the first time with the phone pairing, as long as the customer on the car to start the engine, Bluetooth headset automatically boot, automatically connected to the mobile phone. Call directly to pick up the phone, the phone is automatically switched on after putting back to the base, the phone automatically hang up.

At the same time, as long as the headset is connected to the vehicle charging will be automatically charged, to ensure that your headset will not need to charge their own

2 It's a car charger
It has a dual USB, which can give you two devices (SMARTPHONE PAD, etc.) to charge.

3 He is a metal safety hammer. In an emergency you could not open the door and the window , and it can help you .

Research & development process
ID design

Hardware design process

Structure design process

Our team

story:
Prepare to use the Anystreaming, all you have to do is just connecting the HDMI cable to the devices that you want to use. Anystreaming will send all the HDMI signal wirelessly in real-time. You must download the application to the client device (smartphone, tablet, and other smart devices) in order to use Anystreaming.

First setting

 1) Connect the power 
 2) Connect the UTP cable for a network 
 3) Get the app on the smart devices


   Connect the Anystreaming with a PC or console that you are going to play games, and you can play those games on your smart devices by connecting HDMI cable and run the Anystreaming app. You can enjoy the PC or console games on your smart device because Anystreaming supports 720p/60 fps (Max. 1080p/60fps) with Low Latency. Anystreaming supports standard HID Keyboard, Mouse and Joypad by using USB. To get a wireless control, all you need to do is connect the Anystreaming to your PC or console devices’ USB port .


With a PC or Console

  1) Connect the HDMI cable.
  2) Connect the USB cable.
  3) Run the app.
  4) Play the game. 
  5) Support Co-op play and many people can watch the game at the same time.


   Most of the AV devices support IR but not Wi-Fi. It becomes a problem because remote controller usually has low receiving distance. Maximum 400fit (120m), most of TV remote controller has distance range around 30 fit (10m). One of the functions of the Anystreaming is transfer signal between IR and Wi-Fi. And this function works when it gets the IR signal and send it to the client through Wi-Fi or the Wi-Fi signal from client transfer to the IR signal.


With STB or Streaming Stick (Chromecast, Roku etc.)

  1) Connect the HDMI cable.
  2) Run the app and watch.
      - Chromecast has to be connected with the Smart devices.
      - Such devices as Roku, can be controlled with IR module.
  3) Video can be recorded. 


 

   These days, people at least have one or two smart devices. Nevertheless, the speaker have to prepare the project, projector screen, PC and printing materials and many other things for it. Anystreaming’s Conference View could be the easiest way to prepare your presentation! All the presentation materials could be shared to audiences on their smart devices, so you and the audience are able to focus on the presentation. And this function includes the Touch 2.0 which allows its user to interact with the screen as if you were using a computer mouse such as right, left and double click. If you want to get more information, click here. 


Conference

  1) Connect the HDMI cable.
  2) Connect the USB cable.
  3) Run the app and start the conference.
      - Only one person can control .
      - Can give the control to others.
      - Many people can see the same screen at the same time.
       (screen sharing) 

   Today, one of the best interests of people is IoT. However, most of the electronic devices do not have IoT function, it only has the IR. So, People spend a lot of money to get the new devices for having IoT environment of devices. Fundamentally, Anystreaming provides IR Module. And it supports real time control many electronic devices on a smart device.

IR IoT

 1) Run the app  
 2) Copy the remote controller and save
 3) Use the Wi-Fi and control the IR 







Risks and challenges

   Anystreaming is not a perfectly finished product. We are looking forward to make better one with better performance and design. In order to do this, we need way more product tests and user’s actual feedback. And Indiegogo gives us chance to do that for us (your opinion is very important to us).
  So far, the developed the Anystreaming board can real-time streaming video that has very low latency. It is enough performance for streaming video now. However, we will need to develop the Anystreaming for enjoying the games because it would be better to have lower latency environment for the games than the video streaming. For this, we give a challenge to ourselves to have an optimized hardware and software than before. We need a lot of expenses for the mass production, and those mass product needs to get many certifications which incur more costs. Most of the startup companies have this cost aspects problems and because of that, we need your help to decrease the risk of the problem.
  We will do our best to ship the product to your door on time. However, if there are any problems with it, we will let you know immediately and we will do everything to solve the problem.

We need a lot of expenses for the mass production, and those mass product needs to get many certifications which incur more costs. Most of the startup companies have this cost aspects problems and because of that, we need your help to decrease the risk of the problem.   We will do our best to ship the product to your door on time. However, if there are any problems with it, we will let you know immediately and we will do everything to solve the problem.

story:
Stream live TV without paying for cable TV!

LapStick lets you stream live television to any HDTV that has an HDMI input.  LapStick is a proprietary wireless Windows 8.1 device that plugs into the HDMI port on your HDTV, making any TV able to stream live TV.  Simply insert the device (about the size of a credit card), connect to your wireless network, and stream away.

Easily connect the LapStick and stream live TV



You are paying way too much!

The average cable bill in the USA is $98 per month, or nearly $1,200 per year.  And guess what?  The average number of channels viewed each month is only a staggering 12 channels!  That's roughly $8 per channel, per month, or $100 per channel each year for the networks you watch most frequently.  Sure, we all love the option of 300 channels, but let's be honest, with today's technology, we can find and watch whatever we missed - and bypass all the commercials while doing so!  With LapStick, you're able to eliminate your cable bill and stream Live TV - roughly 45 of the top network channels for $10 per month, or $0.22 per channel.  That puts roughly $1,000 back in your pocket every year!

Why LapStick?

The inspiration for LapStick came from a personal quest to find an alternative to paying for monthly cable just to have the handful of channels I view.  I also needed a way to utilize my current, non-smart TV set top to achieve the goal.  After hours of research, testing, and more testing, I arrived at the best alternative to cable: the LapStick.

There is nothing on the market today like the LapStick to stream live TV and at the same time be a functioning Windows PC!


The Skinny

The LapStick solution to stream live TV consists of the LapStick wireless Windows 8.1 device + a web service that allows you to stream live television channels in High Definition and without ads over broadband Internet access.

The LapStick is actually a mini Windows PC that turns any HDTV into a smart TV.  Smarter and more capable than any "smart TV" on the market because it's a fully-functioning Windows 8.1 PC right on your own TV set top. 

LapStick Specs


The LapStick comes with a HDMI extender cable for easy hookup and access to your HDMI port, as well as an ultra-compact wireless keyboard and mouse.  To stream live TV, simply switch to your HDMI setting on your TV, open the pre-loaded, pre-configured Chrome web browser, select your channel, and stream away.



45 Channels of live streaming TV

I've partnered with a premium streaming website to provide you with a turnkey solution to eliminating your cable bill.  With our partnership, you can stream 45 of the most popular network channels in high definition, with NO ads or popups! Channels such as ABC, NBC, CBS, CNN, FoxNews, ESPN, History, Discovery, Disney Channel, and many more. All for $10 per month!  Each LapStick client will receive the link to this site and the ability to sign up for this service.  This will be an additional revenue stream for CableClipped.com.


Additional Benefits of a Windows PC

On top of the benefit of eliminating your cable bill, with LapStick, your TV set top becomes a fully functioning Window PC.  Use LapStick to check email on your TV, engage with friends via social media sites, view security camera feeds of your home, or turn your TV into a scrolling digital picture frame.  The possibilities are endless!

Come join us today!

Join CableClipped.com today to make our brand and this service available to the masses at an economical price point. A major portion of the funds raised will be used to secure a large order of the LapStick at a price point that allows for an economical alternative to cable television subscriptions. Other funds will be used for marketing our brand as well as building our website with targeted SEO terms and phrases.

We've given a conservative estimate for our delivery dates. We are committed to keeping you informed of our progress both during and following our campaign. We assure you that we are all working very hard to deliver a sensational product that not only arrives on time but is of optimum quality!

About Craig Tabler

I am a 30 year veteran of the IT industry, in many facets including sales and technical support, system admin.  I have 3 startups in the past under my belt as well.

story:
Welcome to The Future of Lighting

This is Easybulb Plus. It allows you to control your home or office lighting using your mobile device and computer via WIFI. It puts the power of your lights in the palm of your hand. Choose from any colour including white light to other colours using the colour wheel on the mobile app. Set the lights to match your mood, control individual lights or groups of lights, use the timer function and night sleep mode to tell your lights to dim gradually within a certain time. Easybulb Plus is energy-saving too so it's earth-friendly.

Easybulb Plus Key Features

Choose Any Colour - There are even psychological aspects to EasyBulb. You can choose to match it to your mood by choosing colours or let the colours determine your mood. Either way, it's amazing to see that people respond to different colours in different ways. Red tends to excite people while blue and green seem to have a calming effect. White is neutral so it wouldn't affect your mood as much. Experiment with different colours in your office or home to see how it affects your mood and temperament. Imagine the applications to dating this gadget provides!

Control your lights from anywhere in the world

The ultimate control that you get of your home devices is priceless and gives you a peace of mind that you can only get when you experience the power in your hands. You can adjust the timing mechanism via your iPhone or Android device while thousands of miles away. Change the lighting in your home to go on or off. Make neighbours and potential intruders think someone is home when you are away on vacation. Also, use EasyBulb to set timers to come on and off at specific times. This thwarts potential burglars and intruders and keeps prowlers far away.  You can almost hear their banter now, "Hey Frank. Don't hit THAT house...there's a poltergeist in there or something man!" Never worry again about theft as you control your home environment from miles away. Operates on the 3G and 4G mobile network.

Talk to your lights

We are truly in the day of when machines talk to each other, our machines talk to us.. and we talk back to them. It's almost like a real relationship. All you need is a translator. Using only your voice, you can use voice commands and your iPhone or smart device (iOS or Android) to tell your lights what to do. Give it voice commands like "Easybulb Blue" and the voice recognition technology will turn your lights to blue and many other functions are readily available at the sound of your voice.You can use the talk to light option to:

  • Pick different colours 
  • Control the brightness of your lights
  • Turn lights on and off


Set Individual Timer

The timer option allows you to control how long lights stay on, and lets you set a time to go off at a certain time. This feature is a great tool whether you are at home or away. No more plugging in analogue timers to AC outlets and controlling setting manually. It's all done quickly and easily with the mobile app.


Control a single light or a group

You can choose whether to control an individual light or groups of lights. Using the latest technology, EasyBulb Plus allows for seamless automation of light planning for public businesses too, including Restaurants, Pubs, Shops, Offices, DJs, Hospitals, and much more.


Your light knows when you get home and when you leave

Proximity control allows you to tell your lights when you are coming into the house by the use of a sensitive notification feature. They can be programmed to turn on when you are at home and switch off when leaving the house. The app controls this process which can be automated once set up.


Use as a Night Light for your child


Sync your itunes and other music

The music sync feature is designed to create a connection between your music collection and your lights. You can use your iTunes collection to sync in time with the lights, and even integrate your other mp3 collections or use a live music source simply by holding it up to the speaker. This fascinating technology allows seamless integration between your music and lights. This feature would be great for a roving DJ or for parties.


Call and message notification

Get phone call alerts and SMS notification using Easybulb Plus calls and SMS light notification features. Your lights indicate you have a call or SMS message by blinking green and white.

You can set this up by a touch of a button on the App. You do not have to enable this feature if you do not want to, but it's nice to know your lights can be your virtual secretary to remind you of your messages or phone calls in case you forget to check them. Kind of like the proverbial "library blinking lights of our youth" which were a noninvasive quiet way of reminding us to "make our final selections and check out."


Memory Function

The Easybulb Plus has a memory function which is designed to resume previous settings in the case of when you switch the light off from the wall switch or in the case of a power loss. So your lights stay the way you left them when the power comes back on.


Easybulb Plus will save you money

EasyBulb Plus was designed with conservation in mind so it is energy-efficient and earth-friendly. It uses a 9 watt LED bulb and 5 watt GU10 spotlights. The unit has a lifespan of around 50,000 hours, which is equivalent to 25 years of average use. EasyBulb Plus also comes free of any harmful chemicals such as mercury and other substances so you know the light that is emanating is not harming you, your family, or the earth. It is environment-friendly and features an efficient "dimming" feature which allows you to increase your savings the more you use it - So You Save as you dim. When compared to standard 60-100W bulbs, the 9W outshines and outlasts them with much less power output.

Website: http://easybulb.com


Still works with your regular light switch


Installation is Easy



Open API

Easybulb Plus API brings out the developer in everyone, allowing you to use various other devices to perform various functions through the system. Use devices such as ZWAVE, Ninja Blocks, and many others to communicate with the system and even program your own app to do what you want. It allows you to do things like:

Operate Easybulb Plus from a computer and send commands to the bulbs online. Turn off lights based on a schedule which you decide. Program it to notify you when you receive an email. Use a microphone with such devices as the Raspberry Pi and issue voice commands. Create "events" which the lights respond to when something happens.

As you can see, EasyBulb allows you to do more than just have home automation. It releases the "programmer" in you to go beyond what it can already do to practically limitless possibilities.


Be creative with your lighting

Allows you to change colours to match your mood or occasion.

Compatible Mobile Device

Devices that can be used to control Easybulb Plus are as below:

  • iOs: All Apple iPhone, iPad and iPod Touch ( Available) 
  • Android OS: All Android phones, tablets and devices (Available) 
  • Windows OS: Windows Phone (Coming soon) 
  • Computer program: open API (Available)

Easybulb Plus Security

Easybulb comes with WPA2 encryption built-in, so only you or authorised person can control your lights.


Easybulb Plus App

The EasyBulb Plus APP will be ready to install on either the iOS and Android system.


Types of Easybulb Plus LED Bulbs

There are two main kinds of Easybulb Plus LED bulbs:

Easybulb Plus RGBW: The RGBW bulbs will give you all of the colours of the rainbow and more, including pure white. The colour bulbs are available in B22, E27, and GU10 spotlight forms.

Easybulb Plus White: This kind of bulb puts out only white lights. It can be changed from cool to warm white to match your preferences. We have designed it to allow the maximum use of the white LED bulbs to produce a bright white light. Also available in B22, E27, and GU10 spotlight forms.


Socket Fittings

The Easybulb Plus is available in B22, E27 and GU10 base fittings. The GU10 comes in 4W to give out 300Lumens while the others comes in 9W and produces over 800 Lumens.


Easybulb Plus can be used worldwide

The Easybulb Plus is truly a "global" product. It can operate between 86Volts and 264Volts making it usable in all countries in the world. So, wherever you are in the world, you will have access to this technology.


Different Cosmetic Colours

Easybulb Plus comes in two standard colours: white and grey, as well as a multitude of different cosmetic colours to choose from, so you can choose your colour based on your preferences.


Business Application

For business owners, such as restaurants or business offices, you will love the ability to control either individual lights or groups of lights with your fingers or your voice through your smart device. DJ's especially love this feature. Here's an idea: If you are a mobile DJ: Set it up as part of your roving DJ package and create your own light show to sync with the music you play at a party or special occasion. Imagine playing a soft white glow with a romantic song as a bride dances with your husband at a wedding reception...or a hot red or purple combination, with alternating colours for a high school dance. This invention certainly adds to the potential for entertainers and businesses alike!


Used in Education

Easybulb Plus has educational applications in art and other fields regarding the study of light and colours. Computer science students can also benefit from the EasyBulb Plus API, which can be used in Programming courses.


Linking the Easybulb Plus with your Home or Office Network

The Easybulb Plus WIFI system can be used to seamlessly link to your home or office network. It also allows you to use programs on either network without having to switch networks. Since Easybulb Plus offers features which can be beneficial to home or office environments, you will likely want to use it in both environments.


Hardware Design

The Easybulb Plus system features a 9W RGBW LED wireless bulb with 12 RGB and 15 white LED chips which allow them to work. Most people use the white lighting for everyday use and the colour lights for setting a mood. Inside the bulb, there is a 2.4 Ghz radio wave receiver which receives commands from the wireless bridge.

Specifications

Easybulb Plus Story

Easybulb Plus was born on the idea in 2012 that we could invent a better lightbulb which was run by our modern smart device technology. We succeeded in launching such a device when we launched the first smartphone-controlled LED lights that year. The original Easybulb was a good invention but it was limited in its ability to function beyond the basics. At Gigateq, we set forward to start improving upon the original concept and we were not afraid to take on the challenge.

We chose to focus on the App features which users would like and also focused on the shape of the bulb. We wanted a shape which would look futuristic while providing the best lighting situation. These improvements allowed us to reach better milestones in our invention and improve upon the design so that it would appeal to the widest market possible. That was how Easybulb Plus was born.


Sleek Design for better lighting

We spent a great deal of time with testing on the shape and design for Easybulb Plus until we designed a shape and created a unit with the properties we needed for optimal heat dissipation and illumination.



Present State

We are very proud of the progress we have made on the Easybulb Plus design and, while there are always improvements which can be made, we feel we are finally ready for market. The app design is complete on iOS and Android, and we have plans to produce an app for the Windows market also soon. Prototypes have been tested and we have secured manufacturing agreements. We plan to use the funds we receive from this campaign to fund our production, advertising, general expenses, and to cover costs of our international licensing. We plan to begin shipping to the Europe., as well as USA, Canada, Australia, China, and Japan in November of 2014.


Perks

All Easybulb Plus Perks come with the following:

Easybulb Plus Bulb – Comes in RGBW and White light types – Sockets can be E27, B22 or GU10. GU10 are 4Watts. 5 colours available.

Easybulb Plus Wifi Controller – To control the lights the Wifi Controller is needed. This will come in every reward.

USB cable – This is used to connect the Easybulb Plus Controller to a power source.

iOS App and Android App (To be available on App Store and Google Play Store)

Easybulb Plus Manual: An easy to use manual will come in different languages.


So what is the process?

Once our Indiegogo is successful you will receive an email from us. This email will include a link to a page where you will be asked to choose the type of Easybulb Plus you want. You will be asked to choose whether you want the RGBW bulb or White light only type. You will also let us know the socket fitting type you prefer and the cosmetic colour for your bulb. The questions will be asked based on your pledge.

We will also be contacting you with updates during the project and we would be happy to remove you from the contact list, if you feel you do not need us to.


Timeline

August - Complete Extensive Product Testing and start working on certification. Certification may take up to 2 months.

September - Indiegogo Campaign Ends and Register App on App Store and Google Play - Takes 2-3 Weeks 

October - Start production - Initial production run and tests. Ship to Early Adopters.

November - Complete production middle of November and ship units to Indiegogo backers.

(We hope to complete shipment before 30th of November 2014)


About Us

Our company, Gigateq Limited was established in 2012, with the intention to represent a company with vision for the future. We had the passion to develop the first LED light which was controlled by WIFI and smart devices in Europe. And this passion and innovation led us to the state of where we are today-with plans for widespread distribution and manufacturing to all borders across the globe. We have come a long way since our humble beginnings, and we are now ready to take this to a global marketplace.

story:
Short Summary - 

Who- I am an app publisher who got tired of ad networks running thousands of impressions for meager few cents 

Why -

a)      Mobile apps are growing exponentially ...so are the ads running on them

b)      Direct ad buying/selling  for apps should be a thing....since it saves money for the adspace buyers and create more revenue for app developers...  Coughs- Win Win !!

c)       We just did that....even better....

  • 0 % revenue sharing..you keep your hard earned $$$
  • you list your app for free...get discovered
  • We made a running and fully functional website...before we come to you asking for your help

The Impact

Why  buy and sell ads directly -

As an ad buyer

  • Work with a real person , share ideas and experiences.
  • None of parties are paying any % to ad network ...which means ....lower prices.
  • You know where you ad is going to run....pick an app related to your product ..higher chances of conversions
  • You can buy a "whole day" on any app and get the stickiness factor for your ad.
  • With this approach you only need to determine if an app  is contextual enough to promote your product/app/website (or whatever). 

As an app publisher

  • No delayed (net 90) payment , no minimum payout
  • Guaranteed eCPM/CPC for a defined period....no guesswork
  • no one gets Any % CUT from your revenues....
  • You have probably seen many ad networks running thousands of impressions for measly ( couple of pennies eCPM )....well no more..!!...ban them and replace them with your contacts f 
  • Use the direct campaign project in conjunction with your default ad network
  • No need to implement our SDK (coz we don't have one)...just use custom ads functionality of your already implemented SDK
  • Use this service in conjunction with your default ad service.

  •  

    What We Need & What You Get

What have we done so far ?
Beta version of website is up and running - fully functional and working

What we want to do with your support ?
a) create Android and iphone Apps
b) Website features enhancements
c) Setup marketing campaigns

Perks>>>

Our perks are designed to not just ask for money but also to provide an added value in return of your support

Other Ways You Can Help

LIST YOURSELF - either your app adspace inventory or campaign to buy ads.

 

- Your time and support is much appreciated

story:
The Dundabunga's internal structure is constructed of a premium heavy gauge and double locked annealed copper, which makes it virtually indestructible.

Features

Deep space grey anodized aerospace aluminum head 

High grade silicone covered permanent neodymium magnets (final Ungabunga will have a silicone cover) 

Ungabunga magnetic piece unscrews to reveal a camera mount

Super soft and flexible nitrile rubber covering

Wearable and adaptable to all surfaces

Magnetic Shielding

All of the Bungajungle Mounts are magnetically shielded. This includes the Dundabunga, Ungabunga, Neutron S and Neutron A. This means that practically no magnetic field will enter into you device. It's a technology that was developed during our previous Kickstarter projects. The magnetic field is restricted to the mounting disc. So, those worried about magnets affecting their device have nothing to worry about. These mounts will never lose their hold, and are not affected by dirt or temperature changes.

Mounting Disc

The disc measures a super slim depth of just .9 mm. Because it is so thin, it can be installed in-between your case and phone. The disc can also be adhered to your Apple, Android, Windows phone or cover with 3M VHB tape. The tape and disc can be easily taken off without damaging your device.

Features a square design with rounded corners and bead blasted texture for a premium finish to match your devices.  Put it on everything to make it mountable!

You can add additional items from our previous campaigns to your pledge level by simply choosing the item(s) you would like and then following the instructions below to add to your pledge! Minimum $15 reward selection.

Our Story  

The Bungajungle products are inspired by travel, open roads, cities, towns, mountains, oceans, and all of nature. The ideas came while living in vans around the continental United States and Hawaii. These designs are inspirations from  that simple life of freedom.

Test
